original: @236b rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @236b rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shr'i he badzra tantra ma h'a r'a dza sa+ya pa nytsi k'a ne tra bi bham ga n'a ma /
analyzed: shr'i he badzra tantra ma h'a r'a dza sa+ya pa nytsi k'a ne tra bi bham ga n'a ma /
translated: Śrī-hevajra-tantra-mahārāja-syā-pañjikā-netrāvibhāga-nāma.

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel spyan 'byed ces bya ba /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel spyan 'byed ces bya ba /
translated: The commentary on the great king of tantras, the glorious Hevajra, called Opening the Eyes.

original: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the glorious Hevajra.

original: sa ma sarba aartha siddha:/
analyzed: sa ma sarba aartha siddha:/
translated: Sama sarva artha siddha.

original: na mo gu ru p'a d'a ya /🔽ae wam ma y'a shru ta ae ka smin sa ma ya bha ga b'a na /
analyzed: na mo gu ru p'a d'a ya / ae wam ma y'a shru ta ae ka smin sa ma ya bha ga b'a na /
translated: Homage to the guru's feet.

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya b'aktsi tta hri da ya badzra yo sh'i ta bha ge shu bi dza h'a ra //
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya b'aktsi tta hri da ya badzra yo sh'i ta bha ge shu bi dza h'a ra //
translated: Evam mayā śrutam ekasmin samaye bhagavān sarvatathāgata kāya vāk citta hṛdaya vajra yośīta bhaga śubha viśva hara.

original: gleng gzhi'i ngag dang po'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i ngag dang po'o //
translated: The introductory statement, the first.

original: 'di yang sgra'i tshul du bshad pa dang / don gyi tshul du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang sgra'i tshul du bshad pa dang / don gyi tshul du bshad pa'o //
translated: This is also explained in the manner of sound and in the manner of meaning.

original: sgra'i tshul la yang gsum ste //
analyzed: sgra'i tshul la yang gsum ste //
translated: In the manner of sound, there are three:

original: sgra'i byed pa'i gnas dang sbyar ba dang / nus pa'i rtsal dang ming khyad par du btags pa'i yon tan to //
analyzed: sgra'i byed pa'i gnas dang sbyar ba dang / nus pa'i rtsal dang ming khyad par du btags pa'i yon tan to //
translated: Applying the basis of the function of sound, the power of potential, and the qualities of the special designation of names.

original: byed pa'i dbang du byas pa ni sgra'i gnas dang sbyar te /
analyzed: byed pa'i dbang du byas pa ni sgra'i gnas dang sbyar te /
translated: The second is from the perspective of the agent, which is connected to the place of the sound.

original: de yang sgra pa'i lugs kyi ti ngan ti'i mtha' can dang su panti'i mtha' can las 'dir su banta by'a k'a ra na'i gnas brgyad do //
analyzed: de yang sgra pa'i lugs kyi ti ngan ti'i mtha' can dang su panti'i mtha' can las 'dir su banta by'a k'a ra na'i gnas brgyad do //
translated: Moreover, in the system of the grammarians, there are eight topics of the Suvyañjana and Suvyañjana, but here there are eight topics of the Suvyañjanavyakaraṇa.

original: gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa las //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa las //
translated: In the phrase “what, etc.,”

original: 'dir gang gis thos na bdag gis thos zhes gsum pa sbyar /
analyzed: 'dir gang gis thos na bdag gis thos zhes gsum pa sbyar /
translated: here, if one hears “what,” one connects it to the third case, “I heard.”

original: gang gi tshe ste dus ni dang po'am ti ngan ta'i gnas mi sbyar /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ste dus ni dang po'am ti ngan ta'i gnas mi sbyar /
translated: If one hears “when,” one connects it to the first case, “at the time,” but one does not connect it to the Suvyañjana topic.

original: gang las thos zhes pas bcom ldan 'das zhes lnga pa la sbyar ba dang / gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang las thos zhes pas bcom ldan 'das zhes lnga pa la sbyar ba dang / gang du zhe na /
translated: If one hears “from what,” one connects it to the fifth case, “the Bhagavān.”🔽If one hears “where,” one connects it to the seventh case, “in the bhaga,” or to the second case.

original: bha ga la zhes bdun pa'am gnyis pa sbyar ba dang / bzhugs zhes par 'khor bstan pas thos pa dang 'brel bas /
analyzed: bha ga la zhes bdun pa'am gnyis pa sbyar ba dang / bzhugs zhes par 'khor bstan pas thos pa dang 'brel bas /
translated: Since the retinue is indicated in the phrase “dwelt,” it is connected to the hearing.

original: 'di rnams kyi phyir zhes bya ste bzhi pa'i sgra sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi phyir zhes bya ste bzhi pa'i sgra sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, one connects the fourth case, “for this.”

original: nus pa'i rtsal ni 'di skad kyis 'di skad nas 'bru la aa'i rnam pa'o zhes pa rgyud mgo zhabs kyi don 'dren pa dang / 'di skad kyis yang sgro ma btags pa dang / skur pa ma btab par bcom ldan 'das las thos shing gzungs nas bsdus zhes pa dang /
analyzed: nus pa'i rtsal ni 'di skad kyis 'di skad nas 'bru la aa'i rnam pa'o zhes pa rgyud mgo zhabs kyi don 'dren pa dang / 'di skad kyis yang sgro ma btags pa dang / skur pa ma btab par bcom ldan 'das las thos shing gzungs nas bsdus zhes pa dang /
translated: The power of potential is indicated by the words “thus” and “thus” and so forth, and the form of the syllable “a” and so forth.

original: nyan pa rnams gus pa dang bcas pa'o //🔽bdag gis zhes pa ni bdag gis mngon sum du thos kyi rgyud kyi brgyud pas ma yin par ston pa dang / thos pa zhes pa ni thos pa rkyang bste /
analyzed: nyan pa rnams gus pa dang bcas pa'o // bdag gis zhes pa ni bdag gis mngon sum du thos kyi rgyud kyi brgyud pas ma yin par ston pa dang / thos pa zhes pa ni thos pa rkyang bste /
translated: Those who listen are endowed with respect.

original: rtogs pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: The word “I” indicates that what is heard is directly heard by me, not by a lineage of the tantra, and that what is heard is heard, not realized.🔽When one hears, one hears, not realizes.

original: thos pa'i gnas skabs na thos kyis rtogs pa ni ma yin te rang gi byas pa ston pa la khyad par med pa dang / gzhan mi gus pas 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: thos pa'i gnas skabs na thos kyis rtogs pa ni ma yin te rang gi byas pa ston pa la khyad par med pa dang / gzhan mi gus pas 'gyur bas so //
translated: This is because there is no difference in showing one’s own action and because others would be disrespectful.

original: sdud pa po'i gnas skabs ni don dang tshig dang bcas par bsdus pas khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdud pa po'i gnas skabs ni don dang tshig dang bcas par bsdus pas khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: The compiler is different because he compiles the meaning and the words.

original: @237a * // dus gcig gis ni yon tan gsum 'dren par byed de /
analyzed: @237a * // dus gcig gis ni yon tan gsum 'dren par byed de /
translated: In one instant, it brings forth the three qualities.

original: dus gcig na 'di thos pa gzhan dag kyang thos zhes pas mang bar ston pa dang / gzhan du ma thos pa dag srid do zhe na /
analyzed: dus gcig na 'di thos pa gzhan dag kyang thos zhes pas mang bar ston pa dang / gzhan du ma thos pa dag srid do zhe na /
translated: In one instant, it teaches the many, since it is said that others also hear it when one hears it, and it is possible that others do not hear it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar gtsor byed pas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar gtsor byed pas so //
translated: The bodhisattva is foremost in uninterrupted effort and in eliminating the obstructions to omniscience.

original: des ni sdud pa po che bar bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sdud pa po che bar bstan to //
translated: This shows the greatness of the compiler.

original: yang dus gcig gis bstan pa dkon par ston to //
analyzed: yang dus gcig gis bstan pa dkon par ston to //
translated: Again, teaching in one instant shows the rarity of the teaching.

original: de'i tshe kho na gsungs kyi gzhan gang du yang ma bstan pas na dkon pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe kho na gsungs kyi gzhan gang du yang ma bstan pas na dkon pa'o //
translated: It is rare because it is taught only at that time and not taught elsewhere.

original: dus gcig ston pa che bar ston te /
analyzed: dus gcig ston pa che bar ston te /
translated: Teaching in one instant shows its greatness.

original: skad gcig ma la thos pas 'khor rnams rnam par thar pa'i skye mched sgrub nus pa'am bya ba rdzogs pa'i skad cig gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: skad gcig ma la thos pas 'khor rnams rnam par thar pa'i skye mched sgrub nus pa'am bya ba rdzogs pa'i skad cig gcig ces bya'o //
translated: In one instant, the assembly is able to accomplish the doors of liberation by hearing it, or it is called one instant of completed action.

original: bha ga w'an gyis ni yon tan gnyis 'dren te /
analyzed: bha ga w'an gyis ni yon tan gnyis 'dren te /
translated: Bhagawan brings forth two qualities.

original: bha ga rnam pa drug tu brjod //🔽ces bya ba /
analyzed: bha ga rnam pa drug tu brjod //🔽ces bya ba /
translated: Bhaga is said to have six aspects.

original: dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs ldan dang // drug po de la ldan zhes brjod //
analyzed: dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs ldan dang // drug po de la ldan zhes brjod //
translated: these six are called “endowed.”

original: ces pas ye shes phun sum tshogs par bstan to //
analyzed: ces pas ye shes phun sum tshogs par bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of wisdom.

original: yang na nyon mongs la sogs bdun //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs la sogs bdun // zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, the seven afflictions, and so on.

original: bha ga w'a na na'i sgra las 'joms pa ste /
analyzed: bha ga w'a na na'i sgra las 'joms pa ste /
translated: The term bhagavān means “conqueror.”

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / phung po'i bdud de rang dbang du ma thob pa dang // 'chi bdag gi bdud de 'chi ba'i dus na gshin rje'i lag tu 'gro ba dang lha'i bu'i bdud ni dga' rab bha ga w'an no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / phung po'i bdud de rang dbang du ma thob pa dang // 'chi bdag gi bdud de 'chi ba'i dus na gshin rje'i lag tu 'gro ba dang lha'i bu'i bdud ni dga' rab bha ga w'an no //
translated: The afflictive demon, such as attachment, the demon of the aggregates, which is not obtaining independence, the demon of the lord of death, which is going into the hands of the Lord of Death at the time of death, and the demon of the sons of the gods, which is excessive joy, are the four demons.

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta ni ta tha'i sgras de kho bha ga w'an no //
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta ni ta tha'i sgras de kho bha ga w'an no //
translated: Sarva tathāgata means “that very bhagavān.”

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta ni ta tha'i sgras de kho na nyid du gshegs pa'am son zhes bya ste chos skur gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta ni ta tha'i sgras de kho na nyid du gshegs pa'am son zhes bya ste chos skur gnas pa'o //
translated: The term tathāgata means “gone to thatness” or “arrived at thatness,” which is to abide in the dharmakāya.

original: ga tas mi rtogs pa'am byon pa ste sku gnyis so //
analyzed: ga tas mi rtogs pa'am byon pa ste sku gnyis so //
translated: The two bodies are the one that is not realized, or that has come, through the going.🔽

original: de yang / dpal ldan de bzhin nyid gshegs shing //🔽de bzhin slar yang gshegs pa nyid //
analyzed: de yang / dpal ldan de bzhin nyid gshegs shing // de bzhin slar yang gshegs pa nyid //
translated: The two bodies are the one that does not go, or the one that has gone, i.e., the two bodies.

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: And it is said:🔽The glorious one has gone to suchness,🔽and he has gone again to suchness.

original: sarba ste rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs bsdus pa nas hri da ste snying po bsdus pa de rdo rje ltar dbyer mi phyed pas rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sarba ste rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs bsdus pa nas hri da ste snying po bsdus pa de rdo rje ltar dbyer mi phyed pas rdo rje'o //
translated: Sarva, i.e., Vairochana, etc., their bodies, speech, and minds are gathered, and the essence is gathered in the hrīḥ. Since that is indivisible like a vajra, it is a vajra.

original: btsun mo la bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: btsun mo la bzhugs pa ste /
translated: It abides in the queen,

original: spyan la sogs pa de rnams 'dus pa bha ga rnams khro ba dang chags pa can 'dul ba la gnas der bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa de rnams 'dus pa bha ga rnams khro ba dang chags pa can 'dul ba la gnas der bzhugs pa ste /
translated: and the bhagas of Locanā, etc., are gathered there. Abiding in the place of subduing the angry and passionate,

original: ye shes kyi snang ba nyid gnas su snang ba de la rdo rje 'chang @237b bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi snang ba nyid gnas su snang ba de la rdo rje 'chang @237b bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Vajradhara abides in the appearance of the appearance of the place of the appearance of pristine consciousness.

original: bi dza ha ra ste gzhi mthun pa'i 'bru mang po pa'o //
analyzed: bi dza ha ra ste gzhi mthun pa'i 'bru mang po pa'o //
translated: Vijahāra is a compound of similar terms.

original: ha ra ni 'phrog pa ste gtso bo'i yon tan gyis 'khor gyi the tshom ston pas 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: ha ra ni 'phrog pa ste gtso bo'i yon tan gyis 'khor gyi the tshom ston pas 'phrog pa'o //
translated: Hara means to take away, and since the qualities of the principal one take away the doubts of the retinue, it is taken away.

original: bzhugs zhes pas yang rgyal po pho brang na bzhugs pas 'khor 'dren te /
analyzed: bzhugs zhes pas yang rgyal po pho brang na bzhugs pas 'khor 'dren te /
translated: The word abiding indicates that the king is in his palace, and that he is surrounded by a retinue.

original: rgyal po gcig tu bzhugs pa ma yin pa dang // thos pa'i 'brel pas 'khor dang bcas pa ston pas 'khor bstan pa dang gzhan dag ni spyod lam dang chos 'chang pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang nang du yang dag 'jog pas bzhugs zhes kyang 'chad do //
analyzed: rgyal po gcig tu bzhugs pa ma yin pa dang // thos pa'i 'brel pas 'khor dang bcas pa ston pas 'khor bstan pa dang gzhan dag ni spyod lam dang chos 'chang pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang nang du yang dag 'jog pas bzhugs zhes kyang 'chad do //
translated: It is not that the king is alone, and the word abiding also indicates the retinue, because it is related to the word heard. Others explain that abiding means that the Buddha is abiding in the deportments, in the Dharma body, in samadhi, and in perfect inner composure.

original: ming khyad par can du btags pa ni 'di skad la ae sin nam ai dam zhes mi zer bar ae wam zhes btags pas log rtog sel te kha cig phyva dang mes po dang dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyur smra ste /
analyzed: ming khyad par can du btags pa ni 'di skad la ae sin nam ai dam zhes mi zer bar ae wam zhes btags pas log rtog sel te kha cig phyva dang mes po dang dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyur smra ste /
translated: The name is given a special designation, because instead of saying aisin or idam, it is designated as evam, which dispels misconceptions. Some say that Ishvara, the grandfather, and so on are the cause.

original: bye brag pa'i lung las /
analyzed: bye brag pa'i lung las /
translated: The Vaisheshika scriptures say:

original: ba ni ba smra ba rnams kyi rgyu //
analyzed: ba ni ba smra ba rnams kyi rgyu //
translated: The cause of cows is the cow-maker.

original: 'gro ba'i rgyu ni dbang phyug ste //🔽dbang phyug gis ni mtho ris sam //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyu ni dbang phyug ste // dbang phyug gis ni mtho ris sam //
translated: The cause of beings is Ishvara.🔽By Ishvara, one falls into the higher realms,

original: ngan 'gro dag tu'ang ltung bar byed //
analyzed: ngan 'gro dag tu'ang ltung bar byed //
translated: Or into the lower realms.

original: ces zer ba de lta bu dgag pa'i ched du ste //
analyzed: ces zer ba de lta bu dgag pa'i ched du ste //
translated: It is in order to refute such a view that the following is stated.

original: ae wam ni chos thams cad kyi pha dang ma lta bu'i 'byung khungs su shes par byed la /
analyzed: ae wam ni chos thams cad kyi pha dang ma lta bu'i 'byung khungs su shes par byed la /
translated: Evaṃ is to be understood as the source, like the father and mother of all phenomena.

original: ae wam ste bde stong dbyer med thabs shes rab dang dbyer med du ston pas na de spong ngo //
analyzed: ae wam ste bde stong dbyer med thabs shes rab dang dbyer med du ston pas na de spong ngo //
translated: Since it shows the inseparability of bliss and emptiness, and the inseparability of method and wisdom, one should not abandon it.

original: de yang ae ni mar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de yang ae ni mar 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, e is the mother,

original: bi na pha zhes bya bar grags //🔽thig le de ni sbyor ba ste //
analyzed: bi na pha zhes bya bar grags // thig le de ni sbyor ba ste //
translated: and vaṃ is known as the father.🔽 The drop is the union,

original: sbyor te de ni rmad 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor te de ni rmad 'byung ba'o //
translated: and that union is the wondrous.

original: zhes pa dang // ae ni shes rab nyid 'gyur la //
analyzed: zhes pa dang // ae ni shes rab nyid 'gyur la //
translated: And, e is wisdom itself,

original: wam gi rab dga'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: wam gi rab dga'i bdag po'o //
translated: and vaṃ is the lord of supreme joy.

original: 'gro ba gang zhig yi ge gnyis //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang zhig yi ge gnyis //
translated: Whoever recites these two syllables,

original: mi shes rtag tu 'don pa dang // des na sangs rgyas chos rnams las //
analyzed: mi shes rtag tu 'don pa dang // des na sangs rgyas chos rnams las //
translated: ignorant of their meaning, will be excluded from the Buddha's teachings,

original: phyi rol sbyor spangs thub pa bzhin //🔽ae wam yig gnyis sgyu ma la //
analyzed: phyi rol sbyor spangs thub pa bzhin // ae wam yig gnyis sgyu ma la //
translated: like the Muni who abandoned union.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa 'dir bzhugs pas //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa 'dir bzhugs pas //
translated: Since the Omniscient One resides here in the illusion of the two syllables evaṃ,

original: dam chos bstan pa'i thog mar ni //
analyzed: dam chos bstan pa'i thog mar ni //
translated: at the beginning of teaching the sublime Dharma,

original: ae wam de phyir rab tu bshad //
analyzed: ae wam de phyir rab tu bshad //
translated: evaṃ is therefore fully explained.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bdag gis la a'a tma'i zer ba ni mu stegs bdag tu 'dod pa yang gang zag pa bdag tu 'dod pa ste //
analyzed: bdag gis la a'a tma'i zer ba ni mu stegs bdag tu 'dod pa yang gang zag pa bdag tu 'dod pa ste //
translated: The word self in the expression the self of the person refers to the self asserted by non-Buddhists.

original: grangs can dag ni yon tan gsum che mnyam pa las gtso bo las bdag ste //
analyzed: grangs can dag ni yon tan gsum che mnyam pa las gtso bo las bdag ste //
translated: The Samkhyas assert that the self is derived from the great one, which is the equilibrium of the three qualities.

original: de las 'gyur ba la //
analyzed: de las 'gyur ba la //
translated: From that, the intellect arises.

original: de las yon tan du ma skye ste //
analyzed: de las yon tan du ma skye ste //
translated: From that, the many qualities arise.

original: 'di tsam nyis shu lnga she na //🔽ral pa'am spyi bo gtsug pud  kyi //
analyzed: 'di tsam nyis shu lnga she na // ral pa'am spyi bo gtsug pud  kyi //
translated: This much is asserted by the twenty-five principles.

original: bsti gnas gang du 'gro ba der //
analyzed: bsti gnas gang du 'gro ba der //
translated: The place where one goes, whether it is the top of a mountain or the crown of one's head,

original: grol 'gyur 'di la the tshom med //🔽ces zer ba bde bzlog pa'i phyir //🔽ma y'a ni sgyu @238a * //
analyzed: grol 'gyur 'di la the tshom med // ces zer ba bde bzlog pa'i phyir // ma y'a ni sgyu @238a * //
translated: one will be liberated there, they say.

original: ma'i bdag nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ma'i bdag nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: To refute that, the word māyā is to be understood as the nature of illusion.

original: bdag ni rtag pa dang gcig pu dang rang dbang du 'dod la /
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pa dang gcig pu dang rang dbang du 'dod la /
translated: The self is asserted to be permanent, unitary, and independent.

original: sgyu ma ni de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pas ni de spong ngo //
analyzed: sgyu ma ni de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pas ni de spong ngo //
translated: Since illusion is not consistent with those characteristics, it refutes that.

original: thos ba shru ba la'am shru ta zer ba ni mu stegs kyi rig byed pa sgra yon tan du 'dod pa sgras chog par 'dzin te ;
analyzed: thos ba shru ba la'am shru ta zer ba ni mu stegs kyi rig byed pa sgra yon tan du 'dod pa sgras chog par 'dzin te ;
translated: The word śruti is to be understood as śruvālaṃ śruta.

original: / de'i lung las /
analyzed: / de'i lung las /
translated: The scripture says:

original: nyes pa rnams dang 'brel pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams dang 'brel pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is related to faults,

original: skyes bu ma byas bden 'don can //
analyzed: skyes bu ma byas bden 'don can //
translated: the person is not the speaker of the truth.

original: zhes sgra rtag par 'dod pa de spong ste /
analyzed: zhes sgra rtag par 'dod pa de spong ste /
translated: This rejects the assertion that sound is permanent.

original: shru ta rgyu bas ma shru ta rig pa shes pas sgra rtag pa de thos bya dang thos byed kyi 'brel pa mi 'thad pas na de bzlog go //
analyzed: shru ta rgyu bas ma shru ta rig pa shes pas sgra rtag pa de thos bya dang thos byed kyi 'brel pa mi 'thad pas na de bzlog go //
translated: Because of the relation of the heard and the hearer, the permanent sound is not tenable.

original: dus gcig na ae ka k'a la mi zer par sa ma ya zer ba ni dus yon tan du 'dod pa yod de /
analyzed: dus gcig na ae ka k'a la mi zer par sa ma ya zer ba ni dus yon tan du 'dod pa yod de /
translated: At one time, it is not said eka kāla, but samaya. This is because time is asserted to be a quality.

original: de yang / skye dgu 'di dag dus kyis bsdus //
analyzed: de yang / skye dgu 'di dag dus kyis bsdus //
translated: It is said: These people are gathered by time.

original: dngos po 'di dag dus kyis byed //🔽ces zer te /
analyzed: dngos po 'di dag dus kyis byed // ces zer te /
translated: These things are made by time.

original: rigs pa can la sogs pa 'dod pa bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pa can la sogs pa 'dod pa bzlog pa ste /
translated: This is the rejection of the assertions of the Naiyāyika and so forth.

original: sa ma ya ni dam tshig de dus dang mnyam pa'i dus dang / ya yo ga sbyor bar 'gro bas na dus rtag pa ni de dag dang 'gal bas na bzlog go //
analyzed: sa ma ya ni dam tshig de dus dang mnyam pa'i dus dang / ya yo ga sbyor bar 'gro bas na dus rtag pa ni de dag dang 'gal bas na bzlog go //
translated: Samaya is the time that is equal to the time, and because yoga goes to the connection, the permanent time is rejected because it is contradictory to those.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: It is said:

original: dus ni rnam pa gsum yin te //
analyzed: dus ni rnam pa gsum yin te //
translated: Time is of three types:

original: bde ba'i dus dang ngan pa'i dus //
analyzed: bde ba'i dus dang ngan pa'i dus //
translated: The time of happiness and the time of misfortune.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab dus yin te //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab dus yin te //
translated: It is the inconceivable time.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bi dza ha ram la stan na'am sti sti be se mi zer ba ni theg zug pa'i rtag pa spong ste //🔽grangs can la sogs rdza chag bye 'phrur du 'dod pa ste //
analyzed: bi dza ha ram la stan na'am sti sti be se mi zer ba ni theg zug pa'i rtag pa spong ste // grangs can la sogs rdza chag bye 'phrur du 'dod pa ste //
translated: The expression vijaharam lastanam stistisesam rejects the static permanence of the Samkhyas, etc., who assert that the pot is the same as the shards.

original: ha ra sa spong ste rjes su mthun pas ston te //🔽'phags pa'i tshul du bzhis bzhugs pa dang ha ras 'phrog bya dang phrog byed du bzhugs pa'am //
analyzed: ha ra sa spong ste rjes su mthun pas ston te // 'phags pa'i tshul du bzhis bzhugs pa dang ha ras 'phrog bya dang phrog byed du bzhugs pa'am //
translated: The expression harasam rejects the Samkhya, etc., who assert that the pot is the same as the shards.🔽The expression vijaharam teaches the concordant, that is, the four abodes of the noble ones, or the abode of the one who takes and the one who takes away, or the abode of the one who possesses qualities and the one who destroys.

original: bi dzi yang yon tan dang 'joms par bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bi dzi yang yon tan dang 'joms par bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The expression lastanam teaches the four abodes of the noble ones, or the abode of the one who takes and the one who takes away, or the abode of the one who possesses qualities and the one who destroys.

original: don bzhin du bshad pa ni gnyis te //
analyzed: don bzhin du bshad pa ni gnyis te //
translated: The explanation according to the meaning is twofold:

original: bshad tshul so sor sbyor ba dang brtag pa phyi ma'i tshul gyis mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bshad tshul so sor sbyor ba dang brtag pa phyi ma'i tshul gyis mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: the individual application of the mode of explanation, and the concise teaching by the method of the later investigation.

original: bshad tshul sbyar ba ni bskyed rim dang rdzogs rim mo //
analyzed: bshad tshul sbyar ba ni bskyed rim dang rdzogs rim mo //
translated: The individual application of the mode of explanation is the generation stage and the completion stage.

original: bskyed rim dmigs par bya ba'i yul gleng gzhi bstan pa dang / nyams su len pa'i thabs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed rim dmigs par bya ba'i yul gleng gzhi bstan pa dang / nyams su len pa'i thabs bstan pa'o //
translated: The generation stage has two parts: the explanation of the basis of the visualization, and the explanation of the method of practice.

original: gleng gzhi ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya bas ni sdud pa po phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya bas ni sdud pa po phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
translated: The nidana, Thus have I heard, shows the perfection of the compiler.

original: sngar bstan pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying po'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying po'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva Vajra garbha, who has the qualities taught above, is on the tenth stage.

original: dus gcig ni phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: dus gcig ni phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: One time is the perfection of time.

original: ston pa gnas dang 'khor la sogs //
analyzed: ston pa gnas dang 'khor la sogs //
translated: The teacher, the place, the retinue, and so forth

original: @238b 'dus pa dus zhes bshad pa yin //
analyzed: @238b 'dus pa dus zhes bshad pa yin //
translated: are explained as the assembly and the time.

original: zhes pa mdo la sogs pa ltar dpyid zlar ba la sogs pa bstan pa bzhi'i dus so //
analyzed: zhes pa mdo la sogs pa ltar dpyid zlar ba la sogs pa bstan pa bzhi'i dus so //
translated: As in the sutras and so forth, the time is the four teachings of the first spring month and so forth.

original: ston pa ni bha ga w'an te gong ma ltar spangs pa dang / ye shes te de dang ldan pa'i rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang rigs bdun pa ste de yang 'og tu 'chad de /
analyzed: ston pa ni bha ga w'an te gong ma ltar spangs pa dang / ye shes te de dang ldan pa'i rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang rigs bdun pa ste de yang 'og tu 'chad de /
translated: The teacher is Bhagavan, who, as above, has the abandonment and the gnosis, and is the cause Vajradhara with seven lineages, which will be explained below.

original: zhal brgyad phyag ni bcu drug ste //
analyzed: zhal brgyad phyag ni bcu drug ste //
translated: He has eight faces and sixteen arms,

original: dpa' bo thod pa'i phreng ba can //
analyzed: dpa' bo thod pa'i phreng ba can //
translated: is a hero with a garland of skulls,

original: phyag rgya lnga ni 'dzin lha la //
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga ni 'dzin lha la //
translated: and holds the five symbolic ornaments.

original: bdag med ma ni nyid kyis zhus //
analyzed: bdag med ma ni nyid kyis zhus //
translated: He was asked by Nairatma.

original: gsungs pas de'i dgongs pa yang rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang 'chad pa por 'dod do //
analyzed: gsungs pas de'i dgongs pa yang rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang 'chad pa por 'dod do //
translated: The intended meaning of that is that the causal Vajradhara is asserted to be the expounder.

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa ni sarba ta th'a ga ta nas dha ga ga la'i bar te khro ba dang chags pas 'dul ba la phyi chos 'byung ba der thos so //
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa ni sarba ta th'a ga ta nas dha ga ga la'i bar te khro ba dang chags pas 'dul ba la phyi chos 'byung ba der thos so //
translated: The perfect place is from sarva tathāgata to dharmadhātu.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni rnal 'bor gyis dbang phyug bye brag brgyad cu ste //
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni rnal 'bor gyis dbang phyug bye brag brgyad cu ste //
translated: The perfect retinue is the eighty specific lords of yoga.

original: rigs lnga dang byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu la gnas pa rnams dang // rdo rje bdag med ma dang spyan la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ri rab kyi rdul phrar ba dang mnyam pa rnams te //
analyzed: rigs lnga dang byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu la gnas pa rnams dang // rdo rje bdag med ma dang spyan la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ri rab kyi rdul phrar ba dang mnyam pa rnams te //
translated: The five families, the bodhisattvas abiding on the ten levels, Vajra Nairātmya, Locanā, and so on, and the emanations of the buddhas, Vajradāka, and so on, equal to the atoms of Mount Meru.

original: de yang 'og ldan ma dang steng zhal ma la sogs pas 'chad do //
analyzed: de yang 'og ldan ma dang steng zhal ma la sogs pas 'chad do //
translated: That is explained by Adhordhva and Adho-mukha.

original: de ltar bur bdag gis thob par bya snyam du 'dod par bya zhes bskyed rim gyis dmigs par byas la de nyid nyams su len pa ni sgrub pa po thun mong dang khyad par gyi yon tan dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de ltar bur bdag gis thob par bya snyam du 'dod par bya zhes bskyed rim gyis dmigs par byas la de nyid nyams su len pa ni sgrub pa po thun mong dang khyad par gyi yon tan dang ldan pas /
translated: One should think, I will attain it in this way, and one should generate the desire. Having visualized the creation stage, one should practice. The practitioner, endowed with common and special qualities,

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa bgegs dang 'tshe ba med par bya ba la 'jug pa sngar langs la lha'i nga rgyal gyis 'chags yod par phyin te /
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa bgegs dang 'tshe ba med par bya ba la 'jug pa sngar langs la lha'i nga rgyal gyis 'chags yod par phyin te /
translated: should enter into the perfect place, which is free of obstacles and harm. Having arisen earlier, one should go to the place with the pride of the deity.

original: bsam gtan gyi bar chad bsal la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bar chad bsal la /
translated: Having removed the obstacles of concentration,

original: 'chags chung ngu phyi'i khrus tsandan la sogs pa sbyar ba'i chus dbang bskur bar mos te khrus bya'o //
analyzed: 'chags chung ngu phyi'i khrus tsandan la sogs pa sbyar ba'i chus dbang bskur bar mos te khrus bya'o //
translated: one should bathe with the small bathing ritual. One should imagine that one is empowered with water that is mixed with sandalwood and so on.

original: nang gi khrus bdud rtsi'i byug pa la sogs pa bya ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi khrus bdud rtsi'i byug pa la sogs pa bya ba'o //
translated: The inner bathing ritual is the anointing with nectar and so on.

original: de nas nang du mandalaa dang mchod pa bshams la thang ka dang 'bur sku rnams bzhugs pa bdag dang rnal 'byor la sogs bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nang du mandalaa dang mchod pa bshams la thang ka dang 'bur sku rnams bzhugs pa bdag dang rnal 'byor la sogs bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having arranged the maṇḍala and offerings inside, one should protect the murals and statues, oneself, the yogin, and so on.

original: de nas mchod pa byin gyis brlab ste /
analyzed: de nas mchod pa byin gyis brlab ste /
translated: Then, one should consecrate the offerings.

original: rang rang gi phyag rgya dang sngags kyi rdzas su byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: rang rang gi phyag rgya dang sngags kyi rdzas su byin gyis brlab po //
translated: One should consecrate them as the substances of the mantra and the seal of each.

original: de nas bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags la /
analyzed: de nas bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags la /
translated: Then, having accumulated the stores of merit and of pristine cognition,

original: re pha sngon du zhes pas ra ba dra ba bsgoms pa'i nang du ae chos 'byung ba sh'ri dang n'i gnas lta bur bsam ste don le'u brgyad par 'chad do //🔽wam gzhal @239a * //
analyzed: re pha sngon du zhes pas ra ba dra ba bsgoms pa'i nang du ae chos 'byung ba sh'ri dang n'i gnas lta bur bsam ste don le'u brgyad par 'chad do // wam gzhal @239a * //
translated: one should meditate on the enclosure and the lattice-work, as previously explained, and within them one should imagine the source of phenomena, which is like the abode of Śrī and Nī, as explained in chapter eight.

original: yas khang 'byung bas chu me rlung rnams zhu ba las byung ba de yang 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: yas khang 'byung bas chu me rlung rnams zhu ba las byung ba de yang 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: The syllable vaṃ is the source of the celestial palace, and the water, fire and wind mandalas which arise from it are melted by the syllable raṃ, as will be explained below.

original: ze'u 'bru dang bcas par thig le byang chub sems la ma y'a dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po bsgom ste //
analyzed: ze'u 'bru dang bcas par thig le byang chub sems la ma y'a dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po bsgom ste //
translated: One should meditate on the lord of the maṇḍala in the seminal essence, which is the bodhicitta, together with the pericarp, as the syllable māṃ.

original: de yang zla ba me long ye shes ldan //
analyzed: de yang zla ba me long ye shes ldan //
translated: Moreover, the moon is endowed with the mirror-like pristine cognition,

original: bdun gyi bdun pa mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: bdun gyi bdun pa mnyam pa nyid //
translated: the seventh of the sevens is the pristine cognition of sameness,

original: rang lha'i sa bon phyag mtshan ni //🔽so sor rtog pa yin zhes zer / de rnams gcig gyur bya nan tan //
analyzed: rang lha'i sa bon phyag mtshan ni // so sor rtog pa yin zhes zer / de rnams gcig gyur bya nan tan //
translated: the seed and insignia of one’s deity

original: rdzogs pa chos dbyings dag pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa chos dbyings dag pa'o //
translated: is said to be the pristine cognition of individual investigation, and the unification of these is the pure pristine cognition of the accomplishment of activity.

original: zhes bya bas mngon par byang chub pa lngas rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang du sprul lo / shru ni rig ma dang bcas pa bzhugs pa las byung ba de /
analyzed: zhes bya bas mngon par byang chub pa lngas rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang du sprul lo / shru ni rig ma dang bcas pa bzhugs pa las byung ba de /
translated: The shru is the arising from the abiding of the knowledge-woman and man.

original: yang ; bar dor bzhugs nas bsrub dang bsrubs pas gtso bo zhu rig ma dang bcas te zhu ba'o //
analyzed: yang ; bar dor bzhugs nas bsrub dang bsrubs pas gtso bo zhu rig ma dang bcas te zhu ba'o //
translated: Again, abiding in the bardo is churning and being churned. The principal one is the melting of the knowledge-woman and man.

original: dus gcig ni zhu ba dang ldan pa'i rig ma dang dus gcig pa'o //
analyzed: dus gcig ni zhu ba dang ldan pa'i rig ma dang dus gcig pa'o //
translated: The simultaneous is the knowledge-woman who possesses the melting.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni glu'i ngor 'bras bu he ru kar langs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni glu'i ngor 'bras bu he ru kar langs te /
translated: The bhagavat is the result, Heruka, who arises in the form of the song.

original: thig le bzhi chad nas rkyen glus bskul nas yud tsam gyis mngon par byang chub pa lngas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: thig le bzhi chad nas rkyen glus bskul nas yud tsam gyis mngon par byang chub pa lngas bskyed pa'o //
translated: The four bindus are the conditions that are aroused by the song. In an instant, the five manifest enlightenments are generated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni nyan pa'i 'khor rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni nyan pa'i 'khor rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The tathagatas are the retinue of listeners who are complete.

original: rang bzhin sangs rgyas rnam pa rdo rje btsun mo ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin sangs rgyas rnam pa rdo rje btsun mo ste /
translated: The vajra queen is the aspect of the natural buddhas.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor rjes su mthun pa'i byang chub pa lngas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor rjes su mthun pa'i byang chub pa lngas bskyed pa'o //
translated: The retinue of yoginis are generated by the five corresponding manifest enlightenments.

original: de nas nyams dga' ba'i grong khyer yin pas bha ga ste /
analyzed: de nas nyams dga' ba'i grong khyer yin pas bha ga ste /
translated: Then, since it is a city of delight, it is the bhaga.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par 'joms pa dag pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par 'joms pa dag pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas so //
translated: Because he is endowed with the pure intuition which completely destroys the afflictions.

original: bzhugs so zhes bya bas ni sems dpa' sum brtsegs dang ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa dang / skye mched byin gyis brlab pa ni gtso bo la bskyed tshul du bsgom mo //
analyzed: bzhugs so zhes bya bas ni sems dpa' sum brtsegs dang ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa dang / skye mched byin gyis brlab pa ni gtso bo la bskyed tshul du bsgom mo //
translated: By abides is meant that one meditates on the triple-being bodhisattva and the invocation of the intuition wheel and the consecration of the sense-fields in the manner of generating the principal deity.

original: sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa dang dbang bskur ba dang // mchod pa dang bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa nyung ldan du bsgom mo //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa dang dbang bskur ba dang // mchod pa dang bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa nyung ldan du bsgom mo //
translated: One meditates on the consecration of body, speech, and mind, the conferral of initiation, the offerings, the praises, the tasting of the elixir, and the abbreviated perfection stage.

original: dag pa rjes su dran pa dang sngags bzlas pa dang gtor ma dang ye shes pa gshegs pa dang dam tshig pa bsdu ba dang bcas pa bzhugs so //
analyzed: dag pa rjes su dran pa dang sngags bzlas pa dang gtor ma dang ye shes pa gshegs pa dang dam tshig pa bsdu ba dang bcas pa bzhugs so //
translated: One meditates on the recollection of purity, the mantra recitation, the sacrificial offering, the departure of the intuition beings, and the withdrawal of the commitment beings.

original: dol mnyam gzhag dang rjes thob kyi rtags 'byung ste //
analyzed: dol mnyam gzhag dang rjes thob kyi rtags 'byung ste //
translated: The signs of meditative concentration and post-concentration arise.

original: thun bzhi'i rim par zhag gnyis dang de bzhin te brten pa chos nas 'jug pa dang rten dang po nang nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: thun bzhi'i rim par zhag gnyis dang de bzhin te brten pa chos nas 'jug pa dang rten dang po nang nas 'jug pa'o //
translated: In the four-session yoga, one practices for two days, and likewise enters the path of the Dharma, and enters the path from within the first reliance.

original: dang po ni ae ste chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang bste thabs snang ba dang // bste dbyer med bdag gis ni bdag nyid @239b du thos shing gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dang po ni ae ste chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang bste thabs snang ba dang // bste dbyer med bdag gis ni bdag nyid @239b du thos shing gsal ba'o //
translated: The first is e, which is the emptiness of all phenomena, and te, which is the appearance of the method, and te, which is the indivisibility of those two. I heard and clarified that for myself.

original: shru ta ste bde ba gong nas gong du 'phel ba'am yang dag gsal rig gi cha ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: shru ta ste bde ba gong nas gong du 'phel ba'am yang dag gsal rig gi cha ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: Śru means the increase of bliss from above or the unimpeded aspect of perfect clarity and awareness.

original: dus ni de nyid snang ba dang stong pa dbyer med pa'i sgom pa ste /
analyzed: dus ni de nyid snang ba dang stong pa dbyer med pa'i sgom pa ste /
translated: The time is the meditation on the inseparability of appearance and emptiness.

original: de yang pha rol phyin pa ni lung dang rgya mtsho rigs pas dpyad de bsgoms la /
analyzed: de yang pha rol phyin pa ni lung dang rgya mtsho rigs pas dpyad de bsgoms la /
translated: Moreover, the pāramitā is analyzed with scripture and reasoning and meditated upon.

original: 'dir ni man ngag gi stobs kyis chos rnams las ye shes skye ba'i tshul du bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'dir ni man ngag gi stobs kyis chos rnams las ye shes skye ba'i tshul du bsgom mo //
translated: Here, the wisdom that arises from phenomena is meditated upon by the power of intimate instructions.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni des mi mthun pa 'joms pa dang ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni des mi mthun pa 'joms pa dang ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān is endowed with wisdom and the destruction of that which is incompatible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'o //
translated: All tathāgatas are the aggregates, constituents, sense spheres, and so on.

original: sku gsung thugs ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum mo //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum mo //
translated: The body, speech, and mind are the three doors of liberation.

original: hri da ya ni snying po ste bsdus pa'am dkyil lo //
analyzed: hri da ya ni snying po ste bsdus pa'am dkyil lo //
translated: The heart is the essence, the summary, or the center.🔽 The queen is the mother, the perfection of wisdom, who gives rise to good qualities.

original: btsun mo ni yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste yon tan bskyed pa'o zhes bzhugs so zhes pa ni chos nyid kyis chos thams cad la khyab pa ste /
analyzed: btsun mo ni yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste yon tan bskyed pa'o zhes bzhugs so zhes pa ni chos nyid kyis chos thams cad la khyab pa ste /
translated: The phrase resides means that reality pervades all phenomena.

original: til can ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs /🔽til la til mar ji bzhin du //
analyzed: til can ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs / til la til mar ji bzhin du //
translated: The sesame refers to the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so forth.🔽 Just as sesame oil is in the sesame seed,

original: bu ram shing la bu ram bzhin //
analyzed: bu ram shing la bu ram bzhin //
translated: and sugar is in the sugarcane,

original: zhes pa'o // rten dang po nang nas 'jug pa ni ae ste shes rab lha mo bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // rten dang po nang nas 'jug pa ni ae ste shes rab lha mo bla na med pa'o //
translated: the supreme goddess of wisdom, E, is the first support, which is the inner entry.

original: ba ni de brten pa'i thabs te yid 'brid pa'i dus su thabs du ma'o //
analyzed: ba ni de brten pa'i thabs te yid 'brid pa'i dus su thabs du ma'o //
translated: The va is the method that supports it, which is the many methods at the time of attracting the mind.

original: nga ni dbang po rang snang ste rab 'bring tha ma gsum ste gser 'gyur gyi tshul dang bya rog lding chags kyi tshul dang rgya mtsho lta bu'i tshul dang nang phyi rol du snang ba dang / phyi nang du snang ba dang / rang sor gnas pa skye'o //
analyzed: nga ni dbang po rang snang ste rab 'bring tha ma gsum ste gser 'gyur gyi tshul dang bya rog lding chags kyi tshul dang rgya mtsho lta bu'i tshul dang nang phyi rol du snang ba dang / phyi nang du snang ba dang / rang sor gnas pa skye'o //
translated: The inner and outer appearances, the outer and inner appearances, and the arising of abiding in one's own place.

original: ma y'a ni spyod lam dang pa sre ste /
analyzed: ma y'a ni spyod lam dang pa sre ste /
translated: Maya is the conduct,

original: za ba dang 'gro nyal du yang skye'o //
analyzed: za ba dang 'gro nyal du yang skye'o //
translated: and it arises in eating, moving, and sleeping.

original: shru ta ni don dam lhan skyes so //
analyzed: shru ta ni don dam lhan skyes so //
translated: Shrut means the ultimate connate.

original: dus gcig ni kun rdzob lhan skyes pa dang dus gcig go //
analyzed: dus gcig ni kun rdzob lhan skyes pa dang dus gcig go //
translated: One time means the connate relative and the ultimate connate at the same time.

original: lhan cig skyes pa de nyid bcom ldan 'das te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa de nyid bcom ldan 'das te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: That very connate is the Bhagavān, as before.

original: gnas gang na bzhugs she na /
analyzed: gnas gang na bzhugs she na /
translated: In what place does he abide?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de sems can thams cad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de sems can thams cad do //
translated: All tathāgatas are all sentient beings.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi lus ngag yid gsum ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi lus ngag yid gsum ste /
translated: The body, speech, and mind are the body, speech, and mind of body, speech, and mind.

original: de kho na rdo rje btsun mo ste /
analyzed: de kho na rdo rje btsun mo ste /
translated: Thatness is the Vajra Queen.

original: shes rab lha mo bla na med pa phyag rgya chen po rten dang brten pa'i tshul du gnas pa na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab lha mo bla na med pa phyag rgya chen po rten dang brten pa'i tshul du gnas pa na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The goddess of wisdom, the unexcelled great seal, abides in the manner of the support and the supported.

original: de ni zag pa med pa'i brten pa yin gyi zag bcas kyi tshul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni zag pa med pa'i brten pa yin gyi zag bcas kyi tshul ni ma yin no //
translated: That is the support of the uncontaminated state, not the contaminated state.

original: de'i phyir dbang rten mi gnas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang rten mi gnas te /
translated: Therefore, the sense organ does not abide in the sense organ.

original: zhib kyang dbang po 'jig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhib kyang dbang po 'jig pa ma yin no //
translated: Also, the sense organ is not destroyed.

original: gnyug ma'i dbang po yod par cis shes she na /
analyzed: gnyug ma'i dbang po yod par cis shes she na /
translated: How is it known that the natural sense organ exists?

original: @240a * // de lung dang rigs pas shes te /
analyzed: @240a * // de lung dang rigs pas shes te /
translated: It is known through scripture and reasoning.🔽The scripture is the following:

original: lung ni / lte bar phyag rgya chen po gnas //
analyzed: lung ni / lte bar phyag rgya chen po gnas //
translated: The great seal abides in the navel.

original: dang po dbyangs yig rang bzhin te //
analyzed: dang po dbyangs yig rang bzhin te //
translated: It is the nature of the first vowel.

original: zhes bya ba dang / phyag rgya chen po dbang bskur ba //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / phyag rgya chen po dbang bskur ba //
translated: The empowerment of the great seal

original: de ni 'di yi byin rlabs yin //
analyzed: de ni 'di yi byin rlabs yin //
translated: is its blessing.

original: zhes gsungs pa //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa //
translated: That is stated.

original: de'i rten yang lung des bsgrub po //
analyzed: de'i rten yang lung des bsgrub po //
translated: Its support is also established by that scripture.

original: phyag rgya chen po nyid dbang rab dang rab las byung ba bsgom pa rab dang rab kyis dang man ngag rab dang rab kyis bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po nyid dbang rab dang rab las byung ba bsgom pa rab dang rab kyis dang man ngag rab dang rab kyis bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The great seal itself is accomplished by the best of the best empowerment, the best of the best meditation, and the best of the best intimate instructions.

original: de la dbang rten yod par yang ye shes yod pas de'i rten yod de //
analyzed: de la dbang rten yod par yang ye shes yod pas de'i rten yod de //
translated: Since the pristine consciousness exists in that, the support of the pristine consciousness exists.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa yod pas rkyen gzhan tshang yang res 'gag par 'dug pas gzhan zhig yod ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa yod pas rkyen gzhan tshang yang res 'gag par 'dug pas gzhan zhig yod ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, since the eye consciousness exists, even though the other conditions are complete, sometimes it stops, and it is said that there is something else.

original: de la goms pa las rtags gzhan yang gsum ste /
analyzed: de la goms pa las rtags gzhan yang gsum ste /
translated: There are three other signs from being familiar with that.

original: mi 'gyur ba ni lta ba'i rtags //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba ni lta ba'i rtags //
translated: The sign of the view is unchanging.🔽The sign of meditation is known

original: dngos po kun la chags med drod //
analyzed: dngos po kun la chags med drod //
translated: to be nonattachment to all things.

original: sgom pa'i rtags su shes par bya //
analyzed: sgom pa'i rtags su shes par bya //
translated: The sign of conduct is known

original: 'jig rten chos brgyad spangs pa ni //🔽spyod pa'i rtags su shes par bya //
analyzed: 'jig rten chos brgyad spangs pa ni // spyod pa'i rtags su shes par bya //
translated: to be the abandonment of the eight worldly dharmas.

original: yang snga ma'i gsum po sems zin pa dang de kho na la 'jug pa dang / dngos grub 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: yang snga ma'i gsum po sems zin pa dang de kho na la 'jug pa dang / dngos grub 'grub pa'o //
translated: Again, the three former signs are the mind being captured, engaging in reality, and accomplishing siddhis.

original: de kho na la yang rtags lnga mthong ba'i lam dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na la yang rtags lnga mthong ba'i lam dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Also, in reality, the five signs are similar to the path of seeing.

original: de rnams gsum pa rtags dang sbyar nas spyod pa gsum rim gyis byed pa'am yang na thod rgal du yang bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams gsum pa rtags dang sbyar nas spyod pa gsum rim gyis byed pa'am yang na thod rgal du yang bya'o //
translated: Those three are applied to the signs and the three conducts are performed gradually or alternatively, they are also performed in a skipping manner.

original: gsum pos kyang lam mjal byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gsum pos kyang lam mjal byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The three also do not meet the path.

original: gnyis kyis ni phyag rgya chen por brgyud dgos la /
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni phyag rgya chen por brgyud dgos la /
translated: Two must be transmitted in the great seal.

original: gcig gis ni thal byung du 'gro'o //
analyzed: gcig gis ni thal byung du 'gro'o //
translated: One goes suddenly.

original: gnyis ni gang zag gi rim pas bshad de /
analyzed: gnyis ni gang zag gi rim pas bshad de /
translated: Two are explained by the stages of persons.

original: yang / las kyi phyag rgya 'phro rgyu can //
analyzed: yang / las kyi phyag rgya 'phro rgyu can //
translated: Again, the one with the seal of karma is a cause of dispersion.

original: de yang ring du spang bya ste //
analyzed: de yang ring du spang bya ste //
translated: That also should be abandoned for a long time.🔽One should meditate with the method of one's own body, and so on, and

original: rang lus thabs dang ldan par bsgom par bya ba dang / de la sogs pa dang / rang bzhin don ni rab bsgrub phyir //
analyzed: rang lus thabs dang ldan par bsgom par bya ba dang / de la sogs pa dang / rang bzhin don ni rab bsgrub phyir //
translated: in order to accomplish the meaning of the nature,

original: 'khor bar thabs gzhan yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'khor bar thabs gzhan yod ma yin //
translated: there is no other method in samsara.

original: zhes pa dang mang du bstan te //
analyzed: zhes pa dang mang du bstan te //
translated: That is also taught many times.

original: de yang rim par 'gro ba'am yang na re re nas brgyud pa yang srid do //
analyzed: de yang rim par 'gro ba'am yang na re re nas brgyud pa yang srid do //
translated: Moreover, it is possible that one goes in stages or that one goes through each one.

original: de la brag pa phyi ma'i tshul gyis don bsdu ba ni 'di ltar snang ba thams cad lhan skyes bde ba chen po yin zhing rang bzhin kyang de ltar sangs rgyas dang sems can thams cad kyang de lta bu'i yang dag par sdom pa yin te /
analyzed: de la brag pa phyi ma'i tshul gyis don bsdu ba ni 'di ltar snang ba thams cad lhan skyes bde ba chen po yin zhing rang bzhin kyang de ltar sangs rgyas dang sems can thams cad kyang de lta bu'i yang dag par sdom pa yin te /
translated: All buddhas and sentient beings are also that, the perfect summary.

original: cis she na /
analyzed: cis she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ae wam ste gnas sam de ru des so //
analyzed: ae wam ste gnas sam de ru des so //
translated: E-vam, in that place or by that.

original: gang gis sdom zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis sdom zhe na /
translated: By what is it summarized?

original: ma y'a ste dbang gi bdag nyid dang ni shes rab dang thabs dbang @240b rnams kyis so //
analyzed: ma y'a ste dbang gi bdag nyid dang ni shes rab dang thabs dbang @240b rnams kyis so //
translated: Ma-ya, by the nature of power, and by the powers of wisdom and means.

original: shru ta ste dgongs pa'i skad du thos pa de'i dbang gis dus la sogs pa'i skabs ngag brda dang lus brdas smra'o //
analyzed: shru ta ste dgongs pa'i skad du thos pa de'i dbang gis dus la sogs pa'i skabs ngag brda dang lus brdas smra'o //
translated: Shrut, heard in the language of intention, by the power of that, one speaks in the language of time, and so on, with symbolic speech and symbolic body.

original: ae ka smin sa ma ya ste dga' ba rnams dang skad cig gi dus su gcig pa ste /
analyzed: ae ka smin sa ma ya ste dga' ba rnams dang skad cig gi dus su gcig pa ste /
translated: E-ka-smin samaya, the ecstasies and the time of the instant are one.

original: shes pa skyes pa'i tshul spong ba dang thob pa'i tshul du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa skyes pa'i tshul spong ba dang thob pa'i tshul du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The way of the arising of consciousness is the way of abandoning and attaining.

original: yang bza' ba ston mo'i dus su dam tshig gcig pa'o //
analyzed: yang bza' ba ston mo'i dus su dam tshig gcig pa'o //
translated: Also, at the time of the feast of eating, there is the same commitment.

original: de dag gis kyang brjod bya'i chos thams cad dang rjod byed kyi chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi sto pa rnams dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rjer 'dus //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang brjod bya'i chos thams cad dang rjod byed kyi chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi sto pa rnams dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rjer 'dus //
translated: All the topics to be expressed and the eighty-four thousand aggregates of topics that express them are included in the glorious Hevajra.🔽The signs of the five paths are as follows:

original: dus zla ba dang lo la sogs par bsgoms pas dang po sprin dang 'dra ba dang / gnyis pa du ba lta bu ste //
analyzed: dus zla ba dang lo la sogs par bsgoms pas dang po sprin dang 'dra ba dang / gnyis pa du ba lta bu ste //
translated: The first is like a cloud, the second is like smoke,

original: gsum pa srin bu me khyer 'dra //
analyzed: gsum pa srin bu me khyer 'dra //
translated: the third is like fireflies,

original: bzhi pa mar me lta bu ste //
analyzed: bzhi pa mar me lta bu ste //
translated: the fourth is like a butter lamp,

original: lnga pa thams cad snang ba ste //
analyzed: lnga pa thams cad snang ba ste //
translated: the fifth is like the sun shining,

original: sprin med nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: sprin med nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: and the sixth is like a cloudless sky.

original: gzung ba dang bral ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang / gnyis ga dang bral ba dang / ye shes rang rig 'char ba dang / chos nyid mthong ba lnga ba'o //🔽rjes thob sgyu ma'i rmi lam sogs //
analyzed: gzung ba dang bral ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang / gnyis ga dang bral ba dang / ye shes rang rig 'char ba dang / chos nyid mthong ba lnga ba'o // rjes thob sgyu ma'i rmi lam sogs //
translated: The five signs of the five stages are the appearance of the mirage, the appearance of smoke, the appearance of fireflies, the appearance of a butter lamp, and the appearance of the sun shining.

original: sgyu ma'i dpe brgyad rim par mthong //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i dpe brgyad rim par mthong //
translated: In the post-equipoise state, one sees the eight examples of illusion, such as an illusion, a dream, and so on.

original: de la spyod pa rnam gsum bya //
analyzed: de la spyod pa rnam gsum bya //
translated: One should engage in the three conducts.

original: de nas 'bras bu go 'phang gnas //
analyzed: de nas 'bras bu go 'phang gnas //
translated: Then, one abides in the stage of the result.

original: zhes bya ste / gang zag spros pa la dga' bas lam de bsgom mo //
analyzed: zhes bya ste / gang zag spros pa la dga' bas lam de bsgom mo //
translated: This is the path for the person who delights in elaboration.

original: de nyid rdzogs pa'i rim par bsgom pa ni gsum ste //
analyzed: de nyid rdzogs pa'i rim par bsgom pa ni gsum ste //
translated: The meditation on reality is threefold.

original: gang zag dbang po dman pa chags pa shas che bas gzhan lus la brten pa dang dbang po 'bring chags pa yang 'bring ni rang lus dang ldan pa dang dbang po rab chags pa chung bas dbyer med phyag rgya chen po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag dbang po dman pa chags pa shas che bas gzhan lus la brten pa dang dbang po 'bring chags pa yang 'bring ni rang lus dang ldan pa dang dbang po rab chags pa chung bas dbyer med phyag rgya chen po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The person of inferior faculty, who has a predominance of passion, has the reliance on another's body. The person of middling faculty, who has a middling passion, has the reliance on one's own body. The person of superior faculty, who has a lesser passion, has the reliance on the great seal of indivisibility.

original: de la dbang bskyed pa'i rim pa nyung ldan te sngar mandalaa dang mchod pa cung zad tsam la brten pa'i sgrub pa pos mos pa'i rnal 'byor ram /
analyzed: de la dbang bskyed pa'i rim pa nyung ldan te sngar mandalaa dang mchod pa cung zad tsam la brten pa'i sgrub pa pos mos pa'i rnal 'byor ram /
translated: The person of inferior faculty has the yoga of imagination, which is the creation stage with few limbs, in dependence on a mere little mandala and offering.

original: bskyed pa'i rnal 'byor ram byin gyis tha mal gyi rnam pa bsgyur te /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rnal 'byor ram byin gyis tha mal gyi rnam pa bsgyur te /
translated: The practitioner transforms the ordinary appearance by the consecration.🔽Moreover,

original: de yang / bdag med rnal 'byor ldan pa'am /
analyzed: de yang / bdag med rnal 'byor ldan pa'am /
translated: one who is endowed with the yoga of selflessness

original: yang na he ru ka dpal brtson //
analyzed: yang na he ru ka dpal brtson //
translated: or else is intent on glorious Heruka.

original: zhes pa rten khyad par can nam lhan cig bsgoms la /
analyzed: zhes pa rten khyad par can nam lhan cig bsgoms la /
translated: One meditates on the special basis or the concomitant.

original: las kyi phyag rgya yang 'og nas g-yung mo rdo rje rigs zhes bya ba dang / gzhan gyi rigs las byung ba'am /🔽gang gi srin lag rtsa ba na //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya yang 'og nas g-yung mo rdo rje rigs zhes bya ba dang / gzhan gyi rigs las byung ba'am / gang gi srin lag rtsa ba na //
translated: The karmamudra is also examined below, beginning with “the vajra family of the yogini” and “arising from another’s family.🔽”

original: rdo rje rtse dgu par gyur pa //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtags shing btsal la //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse dgu par gyur pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtags shing btsal la //
translated: “Whose ring finger is the root of the nine-spoked vajra” and so on.

original: dge ba bcu nas brtsams nas ni //
analyzed: dge ba bcu nas brtsams nas ni //
translated: “Beginning with the ten virtues,

original: de ni chos ni rab tu dbye //
analyzed: de ni chos ni rab tu dbye //
translated: the Dharma is well differentiated.”

original: dbang bskur snying rjer ldan pa de dang lhan cig bsgoms te /🔽de yang lhar mos pa la @241a * //
analyzed: dbang bskur snying rjer ldan pa de dang lhan cig bsgoms te / de yang lhar mos pa la @241a * //
translated: One should meditate with that one who has been conferred empowerment and who possesses compassion.

original: sogs pa bsgoms la //
analyzed: sogs pa bsgoms la //
translated: Moreover, one should meditate on the devotion to the deity and so on.

original: stan bde ba la 'dug ste de la ae ste shes rab kyi gsang ba'i gnas su //
analyzed: stan bde ba la 'dug ste de la ae ste shes rab kyi gsang ba'i gnas su //
translated: Seated on a comfortable seat, one should meditate on the lord of the mudra, the nature of the teacher, in the place of the secret of wisdom, e,

original: wa ste thabs kyi gsang ba'i gnas su //
analyzed: wa ste thabs kyi gsang ba'i gnas su //
translated: and in the place of the secret of means, va.

original: da thig le zla ba dang nyi ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: da thig le zla ba dang nyi ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: The drop is the union of the moon and sun.

original: de nyid ston pa'i bdag nyid ma y'a ste phyag rgya'i bdag po bsgom mo //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa'i bdag nyid ma y'a ste phyag rgya'i bdag po bsgom mo //
translated: That itself is the nature of the teacher, ya, the lord of the mudra.

original: shru ta ni 'dzag cing rgyu ba ste sems dbab pa dang gzung ba dang bzlog pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shru ta ni 'dzag cing rgyu ba ste sems dbab pa dang gzung ba dang bzlog pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sru is the descent and movement of the mind, the descent of the mind, retention, reversal, and so on.

original: dus gcig ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i dus su gcig pa ste //
analyzed: dus gcig ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i dus su gcig pa ste //
translated: The one time is the time of the innate joy, which is one.

original: dga' ba gsum gyi rim gyis bskyed nas bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba gsum gyi rim gyis bskyed nas bsgom pa'o //
translated: Having generated the three joys in sequence, one meditates.

original: bcom ldan 'das de thig le de ston par bshad de //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de thig le de ston par bshad de //
translated: The Bhagavān is explained to be the one who shows that drop.

original: bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with the qualities of the Bhagavān and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nas bha ga rnams la yis ni ae wam de gnas su bstan pa'i phyir yon tan gyi khyad par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nas bha ga rnams la yis ni ae wam de gnas su bstan pa'i phyir yon tan gyi khyad par brjod pa'o //
translated: The one who is thus gone and so forth in the bhagas is expressed as a special quality in order to show that evam is located there.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phung po lnga dang lus ngag yid gsum hri da ya bcud du bsdus pa btsun mo ni phyag rgya'i phung po dang 'byung bas bsdus pas hri da ya ste thig ler gsang ba'i gnas su bzhugs zhes bya ste //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phung po lnga dang lus ngag yid gsum hri da ya bcud du bsdus pa btsun mo ni phyag rgya'i phung po dang 'byung bas bsdus pas hri da ya ste thig ler gsang ba'i gnas su bzhugs zhes bya ste //
translated: The five aggregates of all the tathāgatas and the body, speech, and mind are condensed into the ten śrāvakas. The queen is the aggregate of the mudrā, and since she is included in the elements, she is a śrāvakī. It is said that she resides in the secret place of the drop.

original: sa stengs su zung sa 'og tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sa stengs su zung sa 'og tu gnas pa ste /
translated: The pair is above the earth and below the sky.🔽Moreover,

original: de yang // gnyis 'das nas ni gnyis gnas pa //
analyzed: de yang // gnyis 'das nas ni gnyis gnas pa //
translated: after the two have passed, the two remain.

original: rgyu la 'bras bus rgyas gdab pa'am //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bus rgyas gdab pa'am //
translated: The result is stamped with the cause.

original: 'bras bu la yang rgyus rgyas gdab //🔽ces bya bas gnas pa'am //
analyzed: 'bras bu la yang rgyus rgyas gdab // ces bya bas gnas pa'am //
translated: The result is also sealed by the cause.🔽Thus, one should meditate on the abiding or

original: lus kyi badzra aangga la sogs pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi badzra aangga la sogs pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: the vajra body, etc.

original: de yang thun dang po chung ngu ru bsgom zhing de nas je che je cher bsring zhing bsgoms pas rtags 'byung ste //
analyzed: de yang thun dang po chung ngu ru bsgom zhing de nas je che je cher bsring zhing bsgoms pas rtags 'byung ste //
translated: Moreover, one should meditate in the first session in a small way, and then extend it more and more.

original: sems zin pa'i rtags ni rgyal po dpung bu chung gis mi bskyod pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems zin pa'i rtags ni rgyal po dpung bu chung gis mi bskyod pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The sign of the mind being grasped is the arising of Akṣobhya, etc.

original: de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i rtags ni snga ma'i rnam pa lnga po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i rtags ni snga ma'i rnam pa lnga po 'byung ngo //
translated: The sign of entering reality is the arising of the five aspects as before.

original: dngos grub 'grub pa'i rtags ni thig le snga ma de mig tu bsgoms pas mig gi mngon par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dngos grub 'grub pa'i rtags ni thig le snga ma de mig tu bsgoms pas mig gi mngon par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The sign of accomplishing power is that by meditating on the bindu in the eyes, the superknowledge of the eyes arises.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang lus dang yid kyi gnas su bsgoms na mngon par shes pa rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang lus dang yid kyi gnas su bsgoms na mngon par shes pa rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: Similarly, if one meditates on the bindu in the locations of the ears, body, and mind, the superknowledges arise.

original: rang lus yang ni yang sgrub pa pos snga ma ltar sngon du 'gro ba rnams bsgoms la ae ste skye gnas su //
analyzed: rang lus yang ni yang sgrub pa pos snga ma ltar sngon du 'gro ba rnams bsgoms la ae ste skye gnas su //
translated: Again, the practitioner should meditate on the preliminaries as before in the place of birth, e.

original: ba ste spyi bo'i gnas la song ste thig le'i tshul du 'khrigs shing gnas pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: ba ste spyi bo'i gnas la song ste thig le'i tshul du 'khrigs shing gnas pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par rgyu ba'o //
translated: That is, it goes to the place of the crown of the head and remains there in the form of a drop.🔽It flows without interruption.

original: ma y'a ni bdag nyid de rang gi lus su bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: ma y'a ni bdag nyid de rang gi lus su bsgom pa'o //
translated: The na is the self, that is, one's own body, which is meditated upon.

original: dus gcig ni yang lhan cig skyes @241b ba'i dga' ba ste //
analyzed: dus gcig ni yang lhan cig skyes @241b ba'i dga' ba ste //
translated: The one time is the simultaneously-arisen joy.

original: dam tshig gi dga' ba bzhi lugs 'byung dang lugs bzlog tu skye ste de las lhan cig skyes pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: dam tshig gi dga' ba bzhi lugs 'byung dang lugs bzlog tu skye ste de las lhan cig skyes pa bsgom mo //
translated: The pledge joy arises in forward and reverse order, and from that one meditates on the simultaneously-arisen [joy].

original: bcom ldan 'das ni rang lus su bsgom pa des mi mthun pa 'joms pa dang ye shes dang ldan te rang rang ngo bo mtshon bya mtshon byed myong ba des mtshon bya gnyug ma'i ye shes drungs phyung ste //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rang lus su bsgom pa des mi mthun pa 'joms pa dang ye shes dang ldan te rang rang ngo bo mtshon bya mtshon byed myong ba des mtshon bya gnyug ma'i ye shes drungs phyung ste //
translated: The bhagavat is endowed with intuition and destroys the discordant factors by meditating on one's own body, and by that one's own essence, the indicated and the indicator, the experience, is indicated, and the indicated innate intuition is dug out.

original: dam tshig gi dga' ba chu skyogs gang gi lan tshva rgya mtsho'i chur gi tshogs pa lta bur shes pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi dga' ba chu skyogs gang gi lan tshva rgya mtsho'i chur gi tshogs pa lta bur shes pa'o //
translated: The pledge joy is like a handful of salt in the ocean water.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams thams cad ni phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams thams cad ni phung po lnga'o //
translated: All tathagatas are the five aggregates.

original: sku gsungs thugs ni sgom mo //
analyzed: sku gsungs thugs ni sgom mo //
translated: The body, speech, and mind are the meditation.

original: btsun mo ni 'byung ba bdag pa'o //
analyzed: btsun mo ni 'byung ba bdag pa'o //
translated: The queen is the lord of the elements.

original: bha ga rnams la yid ni chos kun rang gi lus su bsgoms pas mi mthun pa 'joms pa dang ye shes dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: bha ga rnams la yid ni chos kun rang gi lus su bsgoms pas mi mthun pa 'joms pa dang ye shes dang ldan pas so //
translated: The bhagas are the mind. Since all phenomena are meditated on as one’s body, the mind is endowed with gnosis, which conquers the discordant.

original: bzhugs so zhes pa ni lus gdod ma nas rang nyid kyis dag pa'o //
analyzed: bzhugs so zhes pa ni lus gdod ma nas rang nyid kyis dag pa'o //
translated: “Abides” means that the body is pure from the beginning.

original: de la yang rtags gsum snga ma dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la yang rtags gsum snga ma dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
translated: Also, the three signs are applied as before.🔽The great seal of indivisibility

original: dbyer med phyag rgya chen po ni //
analyzed: dbyer med phyag rgya chen po ni //
translated: is the supreme place.

original: sngar bzhin du yang sgrub pa pos gnas phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i rim pa byas la lus lha'i rnam par sngar bzhin du bsgoms la //
analyzed: sngar bzhin du yang sgrub pa pos gnas phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i rim pa byas la lus lha'i rnam par sngar bzhin du bsgoms la //
translated: As before, the practitioner performs the process of perfecting the place, meditating on the body as the form of the deity as before.

original: de yang gnyid de yang brtag pa dang por 'dus pa la de yang le'u'i dang por 'dus //
analyzed: de yang gnyid de yang brtag pa dang por 'dus pa la de yang le'u'i dang por 'dus //
translated: Also, sleep is the first examination, and that is the first chapter of the tantra.

original: de yang yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa bdun du 'dus de yang ae wam ma y'a bzhir 'dus la de yang ae wam gnyis thabs dang shes rab kyi ye shes lhan skyes su 'dod cing shes par byas la bsgom mo //
analyzed: de yang yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa bdun du 'dus de yang ae wam ma y'a bzhir 'dus la de yang ae wam gnyis thabs dang shes rab kyi ye shes lhan skyes su 'dod cing shes par byas la bsgom mo //
translated: Moreover, that is included in the forty-seven syllables, which are included in the four, E-VAM-MA-YA, and those are included in the two, E and VAM, which are asserted to be the innate pristine consciousness of method and wisdom, and should be understood and meditated upon.

original: de ltar sgom pa spyod pa po la 'dzum pa mdzad cing nyi tsher gzigs nas gsungs pa'o //🔽der rnams rnams kyi phyir de la de nas te gnas dang 'khor skabs der sbyar ro //🔽bcom ldan 'das snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgom pa spyod pa po la 'dzum pa mdzad cing nyi tsher gzigs nas gsungs pa'o // der rnams rnams kyi phyir de la de nas te gnas dang 'khor skabs der sbyar ro // bcom ldan 'das snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: Thus, having smiled at the practitioner who meditates in that way, he looked at him with a partial gaze and spoke.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs te gsang bar zhes bya bar nyon cig / snying po shin tu gsang bar zhes bya bar nyon cig rje btsun che gsang bar nyon cig ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs te gsang bar zhes bya bar nyon cig / snying po shin tu gsang bar zhes bya bar nyon cig rje btsun che gsang bar nyon cig ces bya'o //
translated: In that place, the assembly, and the occasion, the Bhagavān, as before, said to Vajrapāṇi, “Listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen to this, Vajrapāṇi, listen

original: de ni sku ni rnam par snang mdzad sku'i gsang ba bya ba'i rgyu dang / gsung ste snang ba mtha' yas gsung gi gsang ba spyod pa'i rgyud dang thugs te mi bskyod pa thugs kyi gsang ba rnal 'byor kyi rgyud de rnams dang ldan par nyon cig / snying po rdo rje 'chang ste shin tu gsang ba bla na med pa'i rgyu dang
analyzed: de ni sku ni rnam par snang mdzad sku'i gsang ba bya ba'i rgyu dang / gsung ste snang ba mtha' yas gsung gi gsang ba spyod pa'i rgyud dang thugs te mi bskyod pa thugs kyi gsang ba rnal 'byor kyi rgyud de rnams dang ldan par nyon cig / snying po rdo rje 'chang ste shin tu gsang ba bla na med pa'i rgyu dang
translated: Listen to the essence, Vajradhara, endowed with the cause of the extremely secret unsurpassed tantra,

original: ldan pa dang rje btsun dgyes pa'i rdo rje ches gsang ba @242a * //
analyzed: ldan pa dang rje btsun dgyes pa'i rdo rje ches gsang ba @242a * //
translated: and the most secret of the venerable Hevajra,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes su nyon cig pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes su nyon cig pa'o //
translated: listen to the innate pristine awareness.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ni rnal 'byor gyi ston pa yin //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ni rnal 'byor gyi ston pa yin //
translated: Vairocana is the teacher of the Yoga tantras.

original: sku rdo rje bya ba'i rgyud dang ji ltar 'brel zhe na //
analyzed: sku rdo rje bya ba'i rgyud dang ji ltar 'brel zhe na //
translated: How is he related to the tantra called the Secret of the Body, the Action tantras?

original: kri ya lus kyi bya ba gtsor ston pa sku rdo rje dang sku'i gsang bar 'brel te //
analyzed: kri ya lus kyi bya ba gtsor ston pa sku rdo rje dang sku'i gsang bar 'brel te //
translated: The Action tantras, which emphasize physical actions, are related to the Secret of the Body and to the Body Vajra.

original: gnyis ka'i rgyud kyang zer //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i rgyud kyang zer //
translated: They are also called the Dual tantras.

original: spyod pa'i rgyud gsungs te lus ngag gi bzlas pa gtsor ston pas snang ba mtha' yas gsungs gsang bar rigs so //
analyzed: spyod pa'i rgyud gsungs te lus ngag gi bzlas pa gtsor ston pas snang ba mtha' yas gsungs gsang bar rigs so //
translated: He taught the Yoga Tantras, which emphasize the recitation of body and speech, and so he is called Amitabha.

original: yo ga ting nge 'dzin gtso bor ston pas thugs mi bskyod pa dang thugs kyi gsang bar rigs so //
analyzed: yo ga ting nge 'dzin gtso bor ston pas thugs mi bskyod pa dang thugs kyi gsang bar rigs so //
translated: He taught the Anuttara Tantras, which emphasize the samadhi of mind, and so he is called Akshobhya.

original: de nas rdo rje snying pos stan las langs te //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje snying pos stan las langs te //
translated: Then Vajragarbha arose from his seat,

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lhang nga sa la btsugs nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lhang nga sa la btsugs nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: put his upper robe over one shoulder, and, kneeling on his right knee, said this:

original: gsang ba gsum po de zhu 'tshal //
analyzed: gsang ba gsum po de zhu 'tshal //
translated: I beg to ask about the three secrets.

original: zhes pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba //
translated: Then the Lord said,

original: ae ma ho byang chub sems dpa' chen po rdo rje snying po snying rje chen po legs so legs so zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: ae ma ho byang chub sems dpa' chen po rdo rje snying po snying rje chen po legs so legs so zhes gsungs te //
translated: Emaho! Great Bodhisattva Vajragarbha, great compassion, well done, well done!

original: ae ma'o zhes pa ni ngo mtshar ba ste //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes pa ni ngo mtshar ba ste //
translated: Emaho means astonishing.

original: sdud pa po dang chos la'o //
analyzed: sdud pa po dang chos la'o //
translated: It is for the compiler and the Dharma.
