original: sdud pa po ni rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug bye ba phrag brgyad cu'i nang nas rdo rje snying po zhu ba po ngo mtshar ba dang // ches gsang ba gsum las ches gsang ba dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhu ba ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: sdud pa po ni rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug bye ba phrag brgyad cu'i nang nas rdo rje snying po zhu ba po ngo mtshar ba dang // ches gsang ba gsum las ches gsang ba dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhu ba ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: The most wondrous of the three most secret is Hevajra, who requested the teachings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is the perfection of one's own purpose.

original: chen po ni gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: chen po ni gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The great is from the perspective of the perfection of others' purpose.

original: rdo rje snying po ni rang rig ste shes rab chen po snying rje chen po ni thabs kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po ni rang rig ste shes rab chen po snying rje chen po ni thabs kyi sgo nas so //
translated: Vajragarbha is self-awareness, the great wisdom. Great compassion is from the perspective of method.

original: legs so legs so zhes pa ni rang don du zhus pa dang gzhan don du zhus pa legs pa gnyis so //
analyzed: legs so legs so zhes pa ni rang don du zhus pa dang gzhan don du zhus pa legs pa gnyis so //
translated: Excellent, excellent is the two excellences: requesting for one's own purpose and requesting for others' purpose.

original: da ltar gyi dus dang ma 'ong pa'i sgo nas legs par 'byung ba gnyis so //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus dang ma 'ong pa'i sgo nas legs par 'byung ba gnyis so //
translated: The two excellences that arise are from the perspective of the present time and the future time.

original: rang gi ngo bo la shes rab dang thabs gnyis kyi sgo nas legs so ba gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la shes rab dang thabs gnyis kyi sgo nas legs so ba gnyis gsungs so //
translated: The two excellences that are stated are from the perspective of the two: wisdom and method, in terms of one's own nature.

original: de ltar gnang ba legs so ba byin nas sku rdo rje la sogs pa rdo rje sems dpa' sogs pa ming gi rnam grangs gzhan gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa ni rdo rje'i tshig dbyings dang ldan pa yin te //
analyzed: de ltar gnang ba legs so ba byin nas sku rdo rje la sogs pa rdo rje sems dpa' sogs pa ming gi rnam grangs gzhan gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa ni rdo rje'i tshig dbyings dang ldan pa yin te //
translated: Thus, having given his approval, the Bhagavān taught the vajra being, etc., by other synonyms such as “vajra body,” etc., with vajra words.

original: yon tan 'di rnams yod de shes bya dang lam dang 'bras bu'i dbang du byas pa dang rnam gzhag gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan 'di rnams yod de shes bya dang lam dang 'bras bu'i dbang du byas pa dang rnam gzhag gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas te bstan pa'o //
translated: These qualities are taught from the perspective of the object of knowledge, the path, and the result, and from the perspective of the stages of the presentation.

original: de la shes bya ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste stong pa nyid shes rab dang / sems dpa' @242b chen po ni thabs te snang ba du ma dang dam tshig sems dpa' zhes pa ni dbyer med snang stong ngo //
analyzed: de la shes bya ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste stong pa nyid shes rab dang / sems dpa' @242b chen po ni thabs te snang ba du ma dang dam tshig sems dpa' zhes pa ni dbyer med snang stong ngo //
translated: Therein, the object of knowledge is the vajra being, which is emptiness, wisdom, and the great being, which is method, the many appearances. The pledge being is the indivisible appearance and emptiness.

original: snying po skye'i rdo rje zhes bya ba ni dbyer med las byung ba che ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: snying po skye'i rdo rje zhes bya ba ni dbyer med las byung ba che ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The vajra of the essence is the great nature that arises from the indivisibility of those two.

original: lam ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni lta ba ste //
analyzed: lam ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni lta ba ste //
translated: The path is the vajra being, which is the view.

original: stong pa yul dang yul can no //
analyzed: stong pa yul dang yul can no //
translated: Emptiness is the object and the subject.

original: sems dpa' chen po ni sgom pa ste bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po ni sgom pa ste bde ba chen po'o //
translated: The great being is meditation, which is great bliss.

original: dam tshig sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni spyod pa sgo gsum gyi tshul dang snying po zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ro gcig go //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni spyod pa sgo gsum gyi tshul dang snying po zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ro gcig go //
translated: The pledge being is conduct, which is the way of the three doors. The essence is the single taste of the result.

original: de ni thun mong lam mngon par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni thun mong lam mngon par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: That is from the perspective of the common path of manifest realization.

original: lam khyad par ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni dga' ba dang sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni mchog tu dga' ba dang / dam tshig sems dpa' ni dga' bral dang snying po dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: lam khyad par ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni dga' ba dang sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni mchog tu dga' ba dang / dam tshig sems dpa' ni dga' bral dang snying po dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: The special path is the vajra being, which is joy; the great being, which is supreme joy; the pledge being, which is joy-free; and the essence, which is the coemergent joy.

original: de yang yod pa dang thob pa'i khyad par gzhan lus la sogs pa skye lugs bla ma'i man ngag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang yod pa dang thob pa'i khyad par gzhan lus la sogs pa skye lugs bla ma'i man ngag las shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the differences between existence and attainment should be understood from the guru’s intimate instructions on the way the body of another arises, and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i rdo rje sems dpa' ni chos sku'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rdo rje sems dpa' ni chos sku'o //
translated: The result is the vajra being, which is the dharmakāya;

original: sems dpa' chen po ni longs sku'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po ni longs sku'o //
translated: the great being, which is the saṃbhogakāya;

original: dam tshig sems dpa ni sprul sku'o //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa ni sprul sku'o //
translated: and the pledge being, which is the nirmāṇakāya.

original: snying po dgyes pa'i rdo rje ni bde ba chen po'i sku bstan pa'o //
analyzed: snying po dgyes pa'i rdo rje ni bde ba chen po'i sku bstan pa'o //
translated: The essence is Hevajra, which is the teaching of the body of great bliss.

original: rnam gzhag rdo rje sems dpa' ni he ru ka phyag gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rnam gzhag rdo rje sems dpa' ni he ru ka phyag gnyis pa'o //
translated: The arrangement is Vajrasattva, which is Heruka with two arms.

original: sems dpa' chen po ni phyag bzhi pa dang // dam tshigs sems dpa' ni phyag drug pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po ni phyag bzhi pa dang // dam tshigs sems dpa' ni phyag drug pa'o //
translated: The great being is the one with four arms, and the being of commitment is the one with six arms.

original: snying po dgyes pa'i rdo rje ni phyag bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: snying po dgyes pa'i rdo rje ni phyag bcu drug pa'o //
translated: The essence is Hevajra, which is the one with sixteen arms.

original: de'i don rgyas par bshad pa ni dris lan gyis 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don rgyas par bshad pa ni dris lan gyis 'chad pa'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of its meaning is the explanation by way of question and answer.

original: rgyas pa'i tshul ni sdud pa po ming gi rnam grangs gzhan du bstan pas the tshom du gyur te yang dris pa dang / rdo rje snying pos gsol pa //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i tshul ni sdud pa po ming gi rnam grangs gzhan du bstan pas the tshom du gyur te yang dris pa dang / rdo rje snying pos gsol pa //
translated: The mode of expansion is that the compiler, having been taught the synonyms of the name, became doubtful and asked again, and Vajragarbha said:

original: gang gi phyir rdo rje sems dpa' lags //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdo rje sems dpa' lags //
translated: “Why is he called Vajrasattva?”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so forth.🔽The answer is:

original: de'i lan // rdo rje mi phyed ces byar brjod //
analyzed: de'i lan // rdo rje mi phyed ces byar brjod //
translated: Vajra is said to be indivisible,

original: sems dpa' srid pa gsum gcig pa //🔽'dis ni shes rab rig pa yis //
analyzed: sems dpa' srid pa gsum gcig pa // 'dis ni shes rab rig pa yis //
translated: and sattva is the unity of the three existences.🔽By this,🔽Vajrasattva is expressed

original: rdo rje sems dpa' brjod par bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' brjod par bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni //
translated: with the knowledge of wisdom.

original: stong pa nyid chos thams cad dbyer mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid chos thams cad dbyer mi phyed pa'o //
translated: Emptiness is the indivisibility of all phenomena.

original: srid pa gsum ste 'dod khams gzugs khams gzugs med pa'i khams gsum stong par gcig pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa gsum ste 'dod khams gzugs khams gzugs med pa'i khams gsum stong par gcig pa'o //
translated: The three worlds, the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm, are the same in being empty.

original: de shes rab kyis gzhal bar byas pa rigs pa de nyid rdo rje dang chos mthun pa ste //
analyzed: de shes rab kyis gzhal bar byas pa rigs pa de nyid rdo rje dang chos mthun pa ste //
translated: That is the reality that is to be evaluated by wisdom, and it is similar to a vajra.

original: sra zhing brtan la khong stong med //
analyzed: sra zhing brtan la khong stong med //
translated: It is hard, firm, and without hollowness.

original: stong nyid rdo rje zhes su @243a * //🔽bshad // ces pa'o //
analyzed: stong nyid rdo rje zhes su @243a * // bshad // ces pa'o //
translated: Emptiness is explained as a vajra.

original: ye shes chen po ros gang la thabs rnam pa sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes chen po ros gang la thabs rnam pa sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is filled with the taste of great wisdom, and it has various methods.

original: rtag tu dam tshig la spyod phyir ni spyod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa la sogs pas sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu dam tshig la spyod phyir ni spyod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa la sogs pas sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
translated: Because it always engages in commitments, it benefits sentient beings through the six perfections and so forth.

original: de dag gi bshad tshul sbyar ba yang bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i tshul te //
analyzed: de dag gi bshad tshul sbyar ba yang bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i tshul te //
translated: The way of applying their explanations is the method of the creation stage and the completion stage.

original: de la bskyed pa'i rim pa ni sgrub po nas kha bskang ba snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de la bskyed pa'i rim pa ni sgrub po nas kha bskang ba snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The creation stage is the same as the previous supplement.

original: rdo rje mi phyed ces bya ba mngon par byang chub pa lnga pos mi phyed pa'i skur bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed ces bya ba mngon par byang chub pa lnga pos mi phyed pa'i skur bskyed pa'o //
translated: The vajra is called “indivisible,” generated as the body of indivisibility by means of the five manifest enlightenments.

original: sems dpa' srid pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rtsa bar rnam par shes pa'i phung po de'i de kho na nyid dgyes pa'i rdo rje rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: sems dpa' srid pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rtsa bar rnam par shes pa'i phung po de'i de kho na nyid dgyes pa'i rdo rje rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The being of existence is the aggregate of consciousness, the root of the aggregates and so forth. Its reality is Hevajra, the causal Vajradhara.

original: ye shes chen po'i ngos gang ba ni rig ma dang bcas te chags pas zhu ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes chen po'i ngos gang ba ni rig ma dang bcas te chags pas zhu ba'o //
translated: The great wisdom is the melting through passion with the knowledge consort.

original: rtag tu dam tshig la spyod phyir ni glu'i ngor byas te //
analyzed: rtag tu dam tshig la spyod phyir ni glu'i ngor byas te //
translated: The constant practice of the commitments is done in the manner of a song.

original: 'bras bu'i he ru ka ra langs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i he ru ka ra langs pa'o //
translated: The result is the arising of Heruka.

original: yang kha bskang ba yang snga ma ltar sbyar ro //🔽rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni gzhan lus shes rab la brten pa dang rang lus thabs dang ldan pa dang / dbyer med phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: yang kha bskang ba yang snga ma ltar sbyar ro // rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni gzhan lus shes rab la brten pa dang rang lus thabs dang ldan pa dang / dbyer med phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: The supplement is to be applied as before.🔽The completion stage is the reliance on the wisdom of another’s body, the method of one’s own body, and the great seal of indivisibility.

original: gzhan lus shes rab la brten pa yang rdo rje mi phyed ni chos 'byung stong pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan lus shes rab la brten pa yang rdo rje mi phyed ni chos 'byung stong pa'o //
translated: The reliance on the wisdom of another’s body is the indivisible vajra, the empty source of phenomena.

original: sems dpa' srid pa ni aa wa dh'u t'i dang ldan pa'i bya rog gi gdong pa can gyi gnas so //
analyzed: sems dpa' srid pa ni aa wa dh'u t'i dang ldan pa'i bya rog gi gdong pa can gyi gnas so //
translated: The hero in existence is the abode of the crow-faced one endowed with the avadhūtī.

original: de ni shes rab ma'i rigs pa ste //
analyzed: de ni shes rab ma'i rigs pa ste //
translated: That is the reasoning of the wisdom mother.

original: rdo rje dpar brjod do //
analyzed: rdo rje dpar brjod do //
translated: The vajra is described as the seal.

original: ye shes chen po ros gang ba ni thabs nor bu ni gzung ba'i mang ngag gis bkang ba ste //
analyzed: ye shes chen po ros gang ba ni thabs nor bu ni gzung ba'i mang ngag gis bkang ba ste //
translated: Filled with the taste of great intuition is the method jewel filled with the multitude of the objects of knowledge.

original: de nas thabs kyi rigs pa phul du phyin pa'i ye shes myangs pas sems dpa' chen por brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas thabs kyi rigs pa phul du phyin pa'i ye shes myangs pas sems dpa' chen por brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, having experienced the intuition of the perfection of the method reasoning, one should be called a great hero.

original: rtag tu dam tshig la spyod phyir //
analyzed: rtag tu dam tshig la spyod phyir //
translated: Because of always engaging in the commitments,

original: zhes bya ba ni rtag tu ni mi 'gyur ba ste lhan cig pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtag tu ni mi 'gyur ba ste lhan cig pa'o //
translated: always means unchanging, that is, together.

original: sa ma ya ni mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: sa ma ya ni mnyam pa'o //
translated: Samaya means equality.

original: ya yo ga ste der sbyor ba ni lus mnyam par sbyor ba ste rdo rje skyil mo krung ngo //
analyzed: ya yo ga ste der sbyor ba ni lus mnyam par sbyor ba ste rdo rje skyil mo krung ngo //
translated: Yoga means union. The union of the body is the vajra posture.

original: rten mnyam par sbyor ba thig le gnyis gnas so //
analyzed: rten mnyam par sbyor ba thig le gnyis gnas so //
translated: The union of the support is the two drops in their places.

original: des gzhan don yongs su rdzogs pas ni //
analyzed: des gzhan don yongs su rdzogs pas ni //
translated: Because of the complete fulfillment of the benefit of others by that,

original: dam tshig sems dpar brjod par bya //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpar brjod par bya //
translated: one should be called the commitment being.

original: zhes pa'o // de la yang lus thabs dang ldan pa la brten pa chags pa 'bring ni rdo rje mi phyed ni lte ba'i gnas stong pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de la yang lus thabs dang ldan pa la brten pa chags pa 'bring ni rdo rje mi phyed ni lte ba'i gnas stong pa'o //
translated: Here, the medium passion is based on the body endowed with the method, the “indivisible vajra” is the empty place of the navel.

original: srid pa gsum ni rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: srid pa gsum ni rtsa gsum mo //
translated: The “three existences” are the three channels.

original: gcig ni aa wa ddh'u t'ir bsdu'o //
analyzed: gcig ni aa wa ddh'u t'ir bsdu'o //
translated: The “one” is gathered in the avadhūtī.

original: der skyes pa'i ye shes ni gzung 'dzin dang bral bas shes rab kyi @243b rigs pa'o //
analyzed: der skyes pa'i ye shes ni gzung 'dzin dang bral bas shes rab kyi @243b rigs pa'o //
translated: The intuition born there is the intuition of the family of wisdom, free from subject and object.

original: des na stod pa nyid kyi ye shes dang shes dang ldan pas rdo rje sems dpa' zhes byar brjod ces pa'o //
analyzed: des na stod pa nyid kyi ye shes dang shes dang ldan pas rdo rje sems dpa' zhes byar brjod ces pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because of being endowed with the intuition of the supreme joy, one is called “Vajrasattva.”

original: ye shes chen po ros gang ba ni bde ba chen po las lus kun du zhu zhing gang ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes chen po ros gang ba ni bde ba chen po las lus kun du zhu zhing gang ba'o //
translated: “Filled with the taste of great intuition” means that the body is completely melted and filled with great bliss.

original: des phul du gyur ba'i ye shes myong bas sems ye shes chen por gyur pa khyad par gyi ro dang ldan pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen por brjod par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des phul du gyur ba'i ye shes myong bas sems ye shes chen por gyur pa khyad par gyi ro dang ldan pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen por brjod par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: Because of experiencing the supreme intuition, the mind becomes great intuition, and because of being endowed with the special taste, one should be called “great hero.”

original: rtag tu dam tshig la spyod phyir ni rtag tu ste steng 'og rgyun mi 'chad par sa ma ya ste //
analyzed: rtag tu dam tshig la spyod phyir ni rtag tu ste steng 'og rgyun mi 'chad par sa ma ya ste //
translated: “Because of always practicing the vow” means that the vow is always, i.e., uninterruptedly above and below.

original: mnyam pa byang chub sems kyis khyab par ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa byang chub sems kyis khyab par ro //
translated: The equality of the great seal is pervaded by the taste of enlightened mind.

original: ya yo ga ste //
analyzed: ya yo ga ste //
translated: Yoga is

original: lus dang sbyor bas mi 'bral bas tshul lo //
analyzed: lus dang sbyor bas mi 'bral bas tshul lo //
translated: the way of not being separated from the body and the practice.

original: des gzhan don ji ltar yang 'grub pas //🔽dam tshig sems dpar brjod par bya //
analyzed: des gzhan don ji ltar yang 'grub pas // dam tshig sems dpar brjod par bya //
translated: Since it accomplishes the welfare of others in any way,🔽it is called the commitment being.

original: zhes pa'o // de la phyag rgya chen po ni chags pa chung ba gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de la phyag rgya chen po ni chags pa chung ba gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te //
translated: The great seal is the small passion of nondual pristine awareness.

original: rdo rje mi phyed ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The indivisible vajra is emptiness.

original: srid pa gsum ni khams gsum mo //
analyzed: srid pa gsum ni khams gsum mo //
translated: The three existences are the three realms.

original: gcig pa ni rang rig 'od gsal dang stong pa 'od gsal lo //
analyzed: gcig pa ni rang rig 'od gsal dang stong pa 'od gsal lo //
translated: The one is the clear light of self-awareness and the clear light of emptiness.

original: ye shes chen po ros gang ba ni thabs snod ba ma bkag par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes chen po ros gang ba ni thabs snod ba ma bkag par bsgom pa'o //
translated: The great pristine awareness filled with taste is the meditation without blocking the method of the vessel.

original: rtag tu dam tshig la spyod ni spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa ste //
analyzed: rtag tu dam tshig la spyod ni spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa ste //
translated: Always practicing the commitment is the uninterrupted practice,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang tshad med pas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang tshad med pas 'jug pa'o //
translated: the engagement with the perfections and the immeasurables.

original: chags can gyi lta bu ni rdo rje mi phyed pa shes rab lha mo bla na med pa ste //
analyzed: chags can gyi lta bu ni rdo rje mi phyed pa shes rab lha mo bla na med pa ste //
translated: The passion-like is the unsurpassed wisdom goddess of the indivisible vajra.

original: sems can kun gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi dbang po'o //
translated: It is the sense organ of all sentient beings.

original: srid gsum lus dag bsdus pa spyi bo dang // rkang par bya ba ste //🔽spyi gtsug nas ni rkang pa'i mthar //
analyzed: srid gsum lus dag bsdus pa spyi bo dang // rkang par bya ba ste // spyi gtsug nas ni rkang pa'i mthar //
translated: The body of the three worlds is gathered in the head and feet.🔽From the crown of the head to the soles of the feet,

original: sdud pa gcig la yang dag brten //
analyzed: sdud pa gcig la yang dag brten //
translated: the one who gathers is well-established.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ye shes chen po ros gang ste der bde ba chen po dbyer med bsgom pa ste ye shes rang 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes chen po ros gang ste der bde ba chen po dbyer med bsgom pa ste ye shes rang 'bar ba'o //
translated: Filled with the taste of great wisdom, there the indivisible great bliss is meditated upon, the self-arisen wisdom.

original: gang ba ni dbang por snang ba'i tshul lo //
analyzed: gang ba ni dbang por snang ba'i tshul lo //
translated: Filled means the mode of appearance of the sense faculties.

original: rtag tu dam tshig la spyod ni spyod lam dang bsres pa ste //
analyzed: rtag tu dam tshig la spyod ni spyod lam dang bsres pa ste //
translated: Always practicing the commitments means mixing with daily activities.

original: rtag tu'am rgyun mi 'chad par rang gi nang gi nyams kyi gzugs dang sgra dbang po rang snang du sbyor ro //
analyzed: rtag tu'am rgyun mi 'chad par rang gi nang gi nyams kyi gzugs dang sgra dbang po rang snang du sbyor ro //
translated: Always, or uninterruptedly, one's inner experience of form and sound is united with the self-appearing sense faculties.

original: dri dang ro gnyis reg bya 'gro 'dug spyod lam du bsre'o //
analyzed: dri dang ro gnyis reg bya 'gro 'dug spyod lam du bsre'o //
translated: Smell and taste are mixed with touch, movement, and sitting.

original: de la yang lta ba'i rtags mi 'gyur ba bsgom pa'i rtags dngos po kun la chags med drod //
analyzed: de la yang lta ba'i rtags mi 'gyur ba bsgom pa'i rtags dngos po kun la chags med drod //
translated: There, the sign of the view is the sign of meditation, the warmth of being unattached to all things.

original: skyod  pa'i rtags 'jig rten chos brgyad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: skyod  pa'i rtags 'jig rten chos brgyad spangs pa'o //
translated: The sign of movement is abandoning the eight worldly dharmas.

original: de yang bsdus pa'i chu la gyis ming btags na //
analyzed: de yang bsdus pa'i chu la gyis ming btags na //
translated: If one gives the name of the collected water to the water of the ocean,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni gsang ba'i don te shes rab lta ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni gsang ba'i don te shes rab lta ba'o //
translated: Vajrasattva is the secret meaning, the view of wisdom.

original: sems dpa' chen po ni shin tu gsang ba'i don te thabs bde ba chen po'i ye shes bsgom pa'o //🔽dam tshig sems @244a * //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po ni shin tu gsang ba'i don te thabs bde ba chen po'i ye shes bsgom pa'o // dam tshig sems @244a * //
translated: Mahasattva is the very secret meaning, the cultivation of the wisdom of great bliss, the means.

original: dpa' ni ches gsang ba'i don te dbyer med par rtag tu spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' ni ches gsang ba'i don te dbyer med par rtag tu spyod pa'o //
translated: Samayasattva is the most secret meaning, the constant practice of the indivisible.

original: yang na gsang ba shin tu gsang ba ches gsang ba ni sngar bzhin du yang sbyar //
analyzed: yang na gsang ba shin tu gsang ba ches gsang ba ni sngar bzhin du yang sbyar //
translated: Or else, the secret, the very secret, and the most secret are to be applied as before.

original: ming bsdus pa ni ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ming bsdus pa ni ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is the name collected?

original: bya ba ni dri ba ste tshul gnyis kyis sngar gyi gsang ba gsum du bshad pa de snying por ji ltar bsdus pa dgyes pa rdo rje ji ltar 'dus pas don yang ji ltar bsdus she na //
analyzed: bya ba ni dri ba ste tshul gnyis kyis sngar gyi gsang ba gsum du bshad pa de snying por ji ltar bsdus pa dgyes pa rdo rje ji ltar 'dus pas don yang ji ltar bsdus she na //
translated: The question is: by what method is the former explanation of the three secrets collected into the essence? How is the meaning of the Hevajra Tantra collected?

original: ming bsdus pas ni ji lta bu //
analyzed: ming bsdus pas ni ji lta bu //
translated: How is the name collected?

original: zhes bya ste //
analyzed: zhes bya ste //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la dang por snying por bsdus pa yang ston pa dang bstan pa'i tshul gyis bsdus te //
analyzed: de la dang por snying por bsdus pa yang ston pa dang bstan pa'i tshul gyis bsdus te //
translated: First, the summary of the essence is summarized by the method of teacher and teaching.

original: ston pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa dang rin chen te yon tan rdo rje dang phrin las rdo rje ste de rnams kun la yang sku rdo rje la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang rdo rje 'dzin zhes pas bsdus
analyzed: ston pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa dang rin chen te yon tan rdo rje dang phrin las rdo rje ste de rnams kun la yang sku rdo rje la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang rdo rje 'dzin zhes pas bsdus
translated: The teacher Vairochana and so on are the vajra body and so on, the vajra of qualities, and the vajra of activity. All of those are also included in the vajra holder who possesses the vajra body and so on.

original: te bye brag 'chad zhes pas bsdus so //
analyzed: te bye brag 'chad zhes pas bsdus so //
translated: The teacher is summarized by the explanation of the distinctions.

original: ston pa don bsdus pa ni rnam snang la sogs pa sku rdo rje la sogs pa ni ye shes lnga la 'chad de de yang byang chub sems las gzhan na med pas 'dir 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa don bsdus pa ni rnam snang la sogs pa sku rdo rje la sogs pa ni ye shes lnga la 'chad de de yang byang chub sems las gzhan na med pas 'dir 'dus pa'o //
translated: The summary of the meaning of the teacher is explained as the five exalted wisdoms of the vajra body and so on of Vairochana and so on. Since those also do not exist apart from bodhicitta, they are included here.

original: bstan pa ming bsdus pa gsang ba gsum kri ya yo ga la sogs pa gsum tha dad du btags pa de gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i ming bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ming bsdus pa gsang ba gsum kri ya yo ga la sogs pa gsum tha dad du btags pa de gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i ming bsdus pa'o //
translated: The summary of the name of the teaching is the three secrets, which are designated as the three different kriya, charya, and yoga tantras. That is summarized by the name Guhyasamaja.

original: don bsdus pa ni bya ba dang spyod pa las rnam grangs du ma bshad pa yang byang chub sems las mi 'da' pas bsdus pa ste des na don de kho na nyid la ston pa dang bstan pa dbyer med do //
analyzed: don bsdus pa ni bya ba dang spyod pa las rnam grangs du ma bshad pa yang byang chub sems las mi 'da' pas bsdus pa ste des na don de kho na nyid la ston pa dang bstan pa dbyer med do //
translated: The summary of the meaning is that the many enumerations explained from the actions and conduct are included because they do not transcend the thought of awakening. Therefore, the teacher and the teaching are inseparable in that reality.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje ming bsdus pas ni don gyi ste ston pa dang / bstan pa bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje ming bsdus pas ni don gyi ste ston pa dang / bstan pa bsdus pa'o //
translated: The summary of the meaning by the name of Hevajra is the summary of the teacher and the teaching.

original: ston pa ming bsdus pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa badzri'i ming gong ma ltar gyur bas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa ming bsdus pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa badzri'i ming gong ma ltar gyur bas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The summary of the teacher by the name is the summary of the vajra body and so on by the name vajra as above.

original: don bsdus pa ni ye shes rnams sems su bsdus la de yang lhan skyes bde chen du 'dus so //
analyzed: don bsdus pa ni ye shes rnams sems su bsdus la de yang lhan skyes bde chen du 'dus so //
translated: The summary of the meaning is that the pristine awarenesses are included in the mind, and that is included in the innate great bliss.

original: 'o na snga ma las khyad par ci yod ce na //
analyzed: 'o na snga ma las khyad par ci yod ce na //
translated: Well then, what is the difference from the previous?

original: 'dir khro ba dang chags pas 'dul ba'i don du'am //
analyzed: 'dir khro ba dang chags pas 'dul ba'i don du'am //
translated: Here, it is for the purpose of taming those to be tamed by anger and desire.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i skad cig ma gnyis la sogs pa yin te gzhan don rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i skad cig ma gnyis la sogs pa yin te gzhan don rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the second moment of the stage of a tathāgata and so on, which is the complete benefit for others.

original: sngar gyi ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar gyi ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: The previous is not like that.

original: bstan pa ming bsdus pa ni lhan skyes gtan la phab pa'am sems dpa' gsum ni he dang badzra dang gnyis bsdus par so sor gsal bar bshad do //
analyzed: bstan pa ming bsdus pa ni lhan skyes gtan la phab pa'am sems dpa' gsum ni he dang badzra dang gnyis bsdus par so sor gsal bar bshad do //
translated: The teaching is summarized in the name, which is explained as the clear light, or the three heroes, which are the two included in he and vajra.

original: sngar gyi sems dpa' gsum gyi yon tan kun ldan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi sems dpa' gsum gyi yon tan kun ldan par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all the qualities of the three heroes are included in that.

original: ston pa dang bstan pa yang 'khor ma 'ongs pa'i gdul @244b bya la dgongs nas rnam gzhag tha dad du bya ba'i don de kho na nyid la ni khyad par med do //
analyzed: ston pa dang bstan pa yang 'khor ma 'ongs pa'i gdul @244b bya la dgongs nas rnam gzhag tha dad du bya ba'i don de kho na nyid la ni khyad par med do //
translated: The teacher and the teaching are also posited as different in consideration of the disciples to be tamed in the future.

original: yang na ming dag tu gong ma bsdus te //
analyzed: yang na ming dag tu gong ma bsdus te //
translated: Alternatively, the former is included in the name.

original: he ni phyi sems can gyi don sdug bsngal dmigs nas skye ba'o //
analyzed: he ni phyi sems can gyi don sdug bsngal dmigs nas skye ba'o //
translated: He is the arising of compassion that observes the suffering of sentient beings, which is the external benefit of sentient beings.

original: chen po ni nang gi lhan cig skyes pa'i ros phul du byung ba'i snying rje rang dbang med par zag pa dang bcas par rnal 'byor pa la ngang gis skye ba'o //
analyzed: chen po ni nang gi lhan cig skyes pa'i ros phul du byung ba'i snying rje rang dbang med par zag pa dang bcas par rnal 'byor pa la ngang gis skye ba'o //
translated: Great is the supreme compassion that arises from the inner coemergent taste, which is involuntary and contaminated, and arises naturally in the yogin.

original: he ni snying chen po ste //
analyzed: he ni snying chen po ste //
translated: He is the great heart.

original: ye shes chen po'i rang bzhin bde ba chen po thabs kyi sgo nas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes chen po'i rang bzhin bde ba chen po thabs kyi sgo nas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The nature of great wisdom is subsumed by the method of great bliss.

original: badzra ni shes rab ste stong pa nyid rig pa'i shes rab chen po'i lta bas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: badzra ni shes rab ste stong pa nyid rig pa'i shes rab chen po'i lta bas bsdus pa'o //
translated: Vajra is wisdom, subsumed by the view of great wisdom that knows emptiness.

original: dbyer med ni bdag nyid kyi rgyu de dam tshig spyod pas bsdus so //
analyzed: dbyer med ni bdag nyid kyi rgyu de dam tshig spyod pas bsdus so //
translated: Inseparable is subsumed by the cause of the self, the conduct of the pledge.

original: des na shes rab kyi rigs pa dang thabs kyi rigs pa dang dbyer med kyi rigs pas dgyes pa'i rdo rje bstan to //
analyzed: des na shes rab kyi rigs pa dang thabs kyi rigs pa dang dbyer med kyi rigs pas dgyes pa'i rdo rje bstan to //
translated: Therefore, Hevajra is taught by the reasoning of wisdom, the reasoning of method, and the reasoning of inseparability.

original: ming bsdus pa'i tshul yang ming gis bsdus pa ste //
analyzed: ming bsdus pa'i tshul yang ming gis bsdus pa ste //
translated: The way of subsuming the name is subsumed by the name.

original: he ni snying rje ste rtag tu dam tshig spyod pa bsdus so //
analyzed: he ni snying rje ste rtag tu dam tshig spyod pa bsdus so //
translated: He is compassion, subsumed by always engaging in the conduct of the pledge.

original: chen po nyid kyis ye shes chen po ros gang bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: chen po nyid kyis ye shes chen po ros gang bsdus pa'o //
translated: By being great, it is subsumed by being filled with the taste of great wisdom.

original: badzra shes rab kyis ni mi phyed pa dang srid pa gsum gcig tu bsdus so //
analyzed: badzra shes rab kyis ni mi phyed pa dang srid pa gsum gcig tu bsdus so //
translated: Vajra is wisdom, subsumed by indivisibility and the unity of the three existences.

original: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rgyud ni rang bzhin pa dang btags pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rgyud ni rang bzhin pa dang btags pa'o //
translated: The tantra of the nature of method and wisdom is natural and imputed.

original: rang bzhin gyi //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi //
translated: The natural

original: rgyud ni rgyun du rab tu grags //
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyun du rab tu grags //
translated: tantra is well known as a continuum.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum yin te //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum yin te //
translated: Moreover, it is threefold:

original: rgyu dang thabs dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang thabs dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: cause, method, and result.

original: de la rgyu'i rgyud sems can rang 'byung ye shes ngo bor gnas pa //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rgyud sems can rang 'byung ye shes ngo bor gnas pa //
translated: Therein, the causal continuum is sentient beings abiding in the essence of self-originated gnosis.

original: thabs kyi rgyud sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs pa //
analyzed: thabs kyi rgyud sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs pa //
translated: The method continuum is mantra, mudrā, and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyud ni rang nyid mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyud ni rang nyid mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
translated: The resultant continuum is one's own direct experience.

original: btags pa la ni 'brel ba dang tshad ba med pa dang ma 'khrugs shing 'brel na rgyud de mngon rtogs ma 'khrugs la tshig 'brel ba ldan pa'o //
analyzed: btags pa la ni 'brel ba dang tshad ba med pa dang ma 'khrugs shing 'brel na rgyud de mngon rtogs ma 'khrugs la tshig 'brel ba ldan pa'o //
translated: In the nominal, there is no connection, measure, or disturbance. If connected, the tantra is not disturbed in the clear realization, and the words are connected.

original: dang po dngos po gnas lugs ston pa dang sdud pa po'i snang ba gnyis pa ni sgrub pa po dang nyan pa'i yid kyi shes pa sgra spyi dang don spyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dang po dngos po gnas lugs ston pa dang sdud pa po'i snang ba gnyis pa ni sgrub pa po dang nyan pa'i yid kyi shes pa sgra spyi dang don spyir bstan pa'o //
translated: The first is the teacher's appearance and the second is the practitioner's and listener's mental consciousness, taught as a word generality and meaning generality.

original: de ni nga yis bshad kyis nyon ni //
analyzed: de ni nga yis bshad kyis nyon ni //
translated: Listen to what I will explain.

original: sngon byung dang rjes 'jug gnyis kar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngon byung dang rjes 'jug gnyis kar sbyar ro //
translated: This applies to both the past and future.

original: de ltar rjod byed ston pa dang brjod par bya ba'i chos bstan nas //
analyzed: de ltar rjod byed ston pa dang brjod par bya ba'i chos bstan nas //
translated: Having thus taught the expressed, the teacher, and the Dharma to be expressed,

original: de nas rgyud kyi don gshad par bya'i tshul yang gsum ste //
analyzed: de nas rgyud kyi don gshad par bya'i tshul yang gsum ste //
translated: Now, the way of explaining the meaning of the tantra is also threefold:

original: gdul bya brjod bskyed pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i yul dang nyams su blang ba'i thabs dang 'bras bu'o /
analyzed: gdul bya brjod bskyed pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i yul dang nyams su blang ba'i thabs dang 'bras bu'o /
translated: the object of meditation, the method of practice, and the result, in order to generate the expression of the disciples.

original: dmigs par bya ba'i yul la yang gnyis te //🔽bskyed pa dang rdzogs @245a * //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i yul la yang gnyis te // bskyed pa dang rdzogs @245a * //
translated: The object of meditation is also twofold:

original: pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: the stage of generation and the stage of completion.

original: bskyed pa la gnyis te //
analyzed: bskyed pa la gnyis te //
translated: The stage of generation is twofold:

original: so sor dmigs pa dang spyir dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: so sor dmigs pa dang spyir dmigs pa'o //
translated: individual meditation and general meditation.

original: spyir dmigs pa ni lta stang dang zhes pa nas rnam mang brjod par bya ba'i bar te brda ni dmigs pa ste //
analyzed: spyir dmigs pa ni lta stang dang zhes pa nas rnam mang brjod par bya ba'i bar te brda ni dmigs pa ste //
translated: General meditation is from “the deity’s seat” up to “the many aspects are expressed.”

original: dbugs dang sngags dang lha'i rnal 'byor ro //🔽rengs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbugs dang sngags dang lha'i rnal 'byor ro // rengs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The symbol is the object of meditation, which is the yoga of the vāyu, mantra, and deity.

original: las rnam bzhi'o //
analyzed: las rnam bzhi'o //
translated: The four activities are the activities of immobilization, and so on.

original: 'o na bde chen ni rdzogs rim yin na //
analyzed: 'o na bde chen ni rdzogs rim yin na //
translated: If great bliss is the stage of completion,

original: bskyed rim du 'chad pa ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: bskyed rim du 'chad pa ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: why is it explained as the stage of generation?

original: de ni lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas so / ji ltar rigs pa rnal 'byor ma 'og nas las dang sngags dang rnal 'byor so sor 'chad do //
analyzed: de ni lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas so / ji ltar rigs pa rnal 'byor ma 'og nas las dang sngags dang rnal 'byor so sor 'chad do //
translated: The yoga of the appropriate one will be explained below, in the individual chapters on action, mantra, and yoga.

original: de yang cis thob na //
analyzed: de yang cis thob na //
translated: How is that attained?

original: bskyed dang zhes pa ni tshogs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed dang zhes pa ni tshogs bsags pa'o //
translated: The accumulation is the generation.

original: gnas dang zhes pa ni rten gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: gnas dang zhes pa ni rten gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The place is the supporting mandala.

original: byed rgyu ni mngon par byang chub pa lnga'o //
analyzed: byed rgyu ni mngon par byang chub pa lnga'o //
translated: The cause of action is the five manifest enlightenments.

original: so sor dmigs pa rengs pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar rigs pa rnal 'byor rnams kyis so //
analyzed: so sor dmigs pa rengs pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar rigs pa rnal 'byor rnams kyis so //
translated: The individual visualizations, such as immobilization, are done by the appropriate yogas.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi don byed pa dang rnam shes ye shes su grub pa dang lus lha rnams su snang ba rang log tu 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi don byed pa dang rnam shes ye shes su grub pa dang lus lha rnams su snang ba rang log tu 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The visualization of the completion stage is the natural cessation of the appearance of the body as the deity, the establishment of consciousness as pristine awareness, and the performance of the benefit of others.

original: de skad du //
analyzed: de skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: mtshon bya mtshon byed mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: mtshon bya mtshon byed mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristic of the indicated and the indicator

original: rnam shes kyis ni ye shes bsam //
analyzed: rnam shes kyis ni ye shes bsam //
translated: is the imagination of pristine awareness by consciousness.

original: ye shes kyis ni shes bya blta //
analyzed: ye shes kyis ni shes bya blta //
translated: Pristine awareness views the object of knowledge.

original: shes byas 'gro ba brtag par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes byas 'gro ba brtag par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: The object of knowledge should be examined by migrating beings.

original: de nyams su blang thabs ni lam gnyis las go rims nges pa'i rgyu mtshan de //
analyzed: de nyams su blang thabs ni lam gnyis las go rims nges pa'i rgyu mtshan de //
translated: The method of practicing that is the two stages, and the reason for the order is this.

original: he ru ka ni zhes tshig rkang gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: he ru ka ni zhes tshig rkang gnyis gsungs so //
translated: The two lines “Heruka” and so on were spoken.

original: bskyed pa'i rgyu ni gnyis te bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rgyu ni gnyis te bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The cause of generation is twofold: the generation stage and the completion stage.

original: de la dang po gcig ni bskyed pa'i rim pa ste //
analyzed: de la dang po gcig ni bskyed pa'i rim pa ste //
translated: Of those, the first is the generation stage.

original: sems can las kyi dang po la //
analyzed: sems can las kyi dang po la //
translated: For sentient beings who are beginners🔽in all activities,

original: las rnams thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: las rnams thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to accomplish all activities,

original: lha yi rnal 'byor rim pa zhig / rgyud las dang por gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: lha yi rnal 'byor rim pa zhig / rgyud las dang por gsungs pa yin //
translated: the stage of deity yoga was first taught in the tantras.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nas bskyed pa'i rim pa sdud pa po the tshom du 'gyur pa khong nas drang ba yang bskyed rim dngos pos mi grol lo zhe na //
analyzed: de nas bskyed pa'i rim pa sdud pa po the tshom du 'gyur pa khong nas drang ba yang bskyed rim dngos pos mi grol lo zhe na //
translated: Then, in order to extract from within the doubt of the compiler about the generation stage, “One is not liberated by the generation stage,”

original: de'i lan yon tan gyi ming gis bos te //
analyzed: de'i lan yon tan gyi ming gis bos te //
translated: the reply is addressed by the name of the good qualities:

original: dngos po la grol ba yang yod 'ching ba yang yod de shes rab dang ma shes pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la grol ba yang yod 'ching ba yang yod de shes rab dang ma shes pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “There is also liberation and bondage in entities, because there is a difference between wisdom and non-wisdom.”

original: 'o na dngos po med pas grol lam zhe na de yang ma yin te //
analyzed: 'o na dngos po med pas grol lam zhe na de yang ma yin te //
translated: But if one says, I am liberated by the absence of entities, that is not so.

original: shes pa dang ma shes pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang ma shes pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is a difference between knowing and not knowing.

original: des na bskyed pa'i rim pa la thabs dang shes rab ming du shes pa dang rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang dri za'i grong khyer lta bur shes @245b pa ste //
analyzed: des na bskyed pa'i rim pa la thabs dang shes rab ming du shes pa dang rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang dri za'i grong khyer lta bur shes @245b pa ste //
translated: Therefore, in the stage of generation, one should know that method and wisdom are like a dream, an illusion, or a city of gandharvas.

original: de ltar he re ka bsgom bya //
analyzed: de ltar he re ka bsgom bya //
translated: As such, one should meditate on Heruka.

original: zhes pa'o // de bzhin du dngos po med pas kyang 'ching bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de bzhin du dngos po med pas kyang 'ching bar 'gyur te //
translated: In the same way, one is also bound by the absence of entities.

original: grol bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grol bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And one is also liberated.

original: dngos med la zhen na chad pa'i lta ba ste //
analyzed: dngos med la zhen na chad pa'i lta ba ste //
translated: If one clings to the absence of entities, that is the view of annihilation.🔽It is said:

original: mar me 'bar ba gsang rung gi //
analyzed: mar me 'bar ba gsang rung gi //
translated: Whether a lamp is burning or not,

original: shi nas ci yang bya rung med //
analyzed: shi nas ci yang bya rung med //
translated: after death, nothing can be done.

original: gsungs pa dang yang //
analyzed: gsungs pa dang yang //
translated: And also:

original: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu ni //
translated: Is not a result similar to its cause

original: kun du mthong ba ma yin nam //
analyzed: kun du mthong ba ma yin nam //
translated: always seen?🔽And:🔽In order to reverse views

original: zhes bya ba dang // lta ba rnam par log rnams dang // bdag tu lta ba bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang // lta ba rnam par log rnams dang // bdag tu lta ba bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: and to reverse the view of self,

original: stong pa rgyal ba rnams kyis gsungs //
analyzed: stong pa rgyal ba rnams kyis gsungs //
translated: the Victorious Ones taught emptiness.

original: zhes pas dngos po sgyu ma tsam rang snang gi sems su bya ste //
analyzed: zhes pas dngos po sgyu ma tsam rang snang gi sems su bya ste //
translated: Thus, the mere illusion of entities is to be taken as the mind that is self-apparent.

original: de ltar he ru ka bsgom bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar he ru ka bsgom bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should meditate on Heruka.

original: spyir kun brtags chos la lam du byed pa dang // gzhan dbang lus la lam du byed pa dang // yongs grub sems la lam du byed pa'o //
analyzed: spyir kun brtags chos la lam du byed pa dang // gzhan dbang lus la lam du byed pa dang // yongs grub sems la lam du byed pa'o //
translated: In general, the imputed is taken as the path in phenomena, the dependent is taken as the path in the body, and the real is taken as the path in the mind.

original: de nyid dman pa dang mchog gi shes par bya ste //
analyzed: de nyid dman pa dang mchog gi shes par bya ste //
translated: Those should be understood as inferior and superior.

original: kun brtags med pa la yod par blos brtags pa dang // gzhan dbang de'i rgyu mtshan rtogs pa'i shes pa //
analyzed: kun brtags med pa la yod par blos brtags pa dang // gzhan dbang de'i rgyu mtshan rtogs pa'i shes pa //
translated: The imputed is the imputation of the nonexistent as existent by the mind; the dependent is the consciousness that realizes the cause of that [imputed nature];

original: yongs su grub pa de nyid zung 'dzin dang bral ba ste //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa de nyid zung 'dzin dang bral ba ste //
translated: and the real is free from the apprehender and the apprehended.

original: dman pa'i rnam pa gsum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dman pa'i rnam pa gsum zhes bya'o //
translated: Those three are called “inferior.”

original: mchog gi gsum ni spyir lha'i 'khor lor brtags pas kun brtags /
analyzed: mchog gi gsum ni spyir lha'i 'khor lor brtags pas kun brtags /
translated: The three superior [natures] are as follows: In general, the imputed is the imagined divine wheel.

original: lus rtsa dang 'khor lor snang ba de gzhan dbang //
analyzed: lus rtsa dang 'khor lor snang ba de gzhan dbang //
translated: The dependent is the appearance of the body as nāḍīs and cakras.

original: ye shes bde ba chen po yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes bde ba chen po yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The real is the gnosis of great bliss.

original: de la dang po la gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dang po la gsum ste /
translated: The first of those has three parts:

original: kun brtags kyi kun brtags sa bon dang mtshan mas bskyed pa'i rang rgyud du rtogs pa dang // gzhan dbang ye shes kyi snang bar byas pa dang // yongs grub bde ba chen pos byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi kun brtags sa bon dang mtshan mas bskyed pa'i rang rgyud du rtogs pa dang // gzhan dbang ye shes kyi snang bar byas pa dang // yongs grub bde ba chen pos byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: The consummate is the empowerment of great bliss.

original: gzhan dbang gi gsum ni kun brtags ni rtsa phal ba'am 'khor lo gsum mo //
analyzed: gzhan dbang gi gsum ni kun brtags ni rtsa phal ba'am 'khor lo gsum mo //
translated: The three of the dependent are the imagined, which is the three channels or the three wheels.

original: rtsa gsum dang rtsa gcig ni gzhan dbang gi gzhan dbang ngo //
analyzed: rtsa gsum dang rtsa gcig ni gzhan dbang gi gzhan dbang ngo //
translated: The three channels and the one channel are the dependent of the dependent.

original: rtsa aa wa dh'u t'i 'am mchog gi dbang po ni gzhan dbang gi yongs grub bo //
analyzed: rtsa aa wa dh'u t'i 'am mchog gi dbang po ni gzhan dbang gi yongs grub bo //
translated: The channel avadhūtī or the supreme organ is the consummate of the dependent.

original: yang na shes rab kyi rtsa kun brtags //
analyzed: yang na shes rab kyi rtsa kun brtags //
translated: Alternatively, the channel of wisdom is the imagined.

original: thabs kyi rtsa gzhan dbang //
analyzed: thabs kyi rtsa gzhan dbang //
translated: The channel of method is the dependent.

original: dbyer med yongs grub po //
analyzed: dbyer med yongs grub po //
translated: The indivisible is the consummate.

original: de rnams kun rdzob rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kun rdzob rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Those are the relative.

original: yar bskyed rim dang rdzogs rim dang // yongs su rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: yar bskyed rim dang rdzogs rim dang // yongs su rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is the three stages: the stage of generation, the stage of completion, and the stage of total completion.

original: yongs grub kyi kun brtags ni mtshon bya kun rdzob //
analyzed: yongs grub kyi kun brtags ni mtshon bya kun rdzob //
translated: The imagined of the consummate is the relative object of expression.

original: gzhan dbang gi mtshon bya don dam //
analyzed: gzhan dbang gi mtshon bya don dam //
translated: The dependent is the ultimate object of expression.

original: yongs grub ni dbyer med do / yang na stong pa nyid kun brtags //🔽rig pa gsal ba gang dbang //🔽de gnyis dbyer med @246a * //🔽yongs sgrub po //
analyzed: yongs grub ni dbyer med do / yang na stong pa nyid kun brtags // rig pa gsal ba gang dbang // de gnyis dbyer med @246a * // yongs sgrub po //
translated: and their indivisibility is the consummate.

original: de rnams nyams su blang ba ni /
analyzed: de rnams nyams su blang ba ni /
translated: The practice of those is

original: de nyid nges par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid nges par bya ste /
translated: ascertained to be🔽the path of method and the path of liberation.🔽The path of method is the practice of the creation stage, the yoga of the deity, and so on, as in the third chapter and the fifth chapter of the Later Tantra.🔽The path of liberation is the practice of the completion stage, the yoga of the channels, winds, and bindus, and so on, as in the first chapter and the eighth chapter.

original: chos la lam du byed pa bskyed rim lha'i rnal 'byor sgrub thabs bzhin du le'u gsum pa dang / brtag pa phyi ma'i le'u lnga pa ltar bya ba dang lus la lam du byed pa dang / gzhan lus dang rang lus te ;
analyzed: chos la lam du byed pa bskyed rim lha'i rnal 'byor sgrub thabs bzhin du le'u gsum pa dang / brtag pa phyi ma'i le'u lnga pa ltar bya ba dang lus la lam du byed pa dang / gzhan lus dang rang lus te ;
translated: The path of method is the practice of the creation stage, the yoga of the deity, and so on, as in the third chapter and the fifth chapter of the Later Tantra.🔽The path of liberation is the practice of the completion stage, the yoga of the channels, winds, and bindus, and so on, as in the first chapter and the eighth chapter.🔽The path of method is the practice of the creation stage, the yoga of the deity, and so on, as in the third chapter and the fifth chapter of the Later Tantra.🔽The path of liberation is the practice of the completion stage, the yoga of the channels, winds, and bindus, and so on, as in the first chapter and the eighth chapter.🔽The path of method is the practice of the creation stage, the yoga of the deity, and so on, as in the third chapter and the fifth chapter of the Later Tantra.🔽The path of liberation is the practice of the completion stage, the yoga of the channels, winds, and bindus, and so on, as in the first chapter and the eighth chapter.🔽The path of method is the practice of the creation stage, the yoga of the deity, and so on, as in the third chapter and the fifth chapter of the Later Tantra.🔽The path of liberation is the practice of the completion stage, the yoga of the channels, winds, and bindus, and so on, as in the first chapter and the eighth chapter.

original: / rtsa dang byang chub sems gzung ba la sogs pa dga' ba bzhi bsgom pa ste le'u bsgom pa ste le'u dang po dang brgyad pa dang brtag pa phyi ma'i le'u gnyis pa dang lnga pa las 'byung ba bsgom mo //🔽sems la lam du byed pa sems la bslab pa ste /
analyzed: / rtsa dang byang chub sems gzung ba la sogs pa dga' ba bzhi bsgom pa ste le'u bsgom pa ste le'u dang po dang brgyad pa dang brtag pa phyi ma'i le'u gnyis pa dang lnga pa las 'byung ba bsgom mo // sems la lam du byed pa sems la bslab pa ste /
translated: The path of method is the practice of the creation stage, the yoga of the deity, and so on, as in the third chapter and the fifth chapter of the Later Tantra.

original: thabs du mas bslab pa'o //
analyzed: thabs du mas bslab pa'o //
translated: The path of liberation is the practice of the completion stage

original: lam gnyis te bskyed rim mang bar bya ste rdzogs rim nyung ldan sgrub thabs bzhin sgom pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa mang ldan bskyed rim nyung ldan te mos pa'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'am yan lag bzhi bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: lam gnyis te bskyed rim mang bar bya ste rdzogs rim nyung ldan sgrub thabs bzhin sgom pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa mang ldan bskyed rim nyung ldan te mos pa'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'am yan lag bzhi bsgom pa'o //
translated: There are two paths: one is to practice the perfection stage with few [aspects] and the creation stage with many, which is meditation according to the sādhana; and the other is to practice the creation stage with few [aspects] and the perfection stage with many, which is the yoga of imagination and so forth, or the meditation on the four branches.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la bzhi ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection stage has four [aspects]:

original: ngo bo ye shes chen po bstan pa dang rten rdo rje'i lus lam du byed pa dang / ldan pa'i chos sdom pa'i dbye ba dang / nyams su len pa rlung la bslab pa dang gtum mo sbar ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo ye shes chen po bstan pa dang rten rdo rje'i lus lam du byed pa dang / ldan pa'i chos sdom pa'i dbye ba dang / nyams su len pa rlung la bslab pa dang gtum mo sbar ba'o //
translated: the teaching of the nature of great wisdom, the path of taking the vajra body as the basis, the divisions of the vows that are the possessed phenomena, and the practice of training in the vāyu and igniting the caṇḍālī.

original: ye shes chen po'i rang bzhin la shes par bya ba dang / sgom pa nyams su len pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes chen po'i rang bzhin la shes par bya ba dang / sgom pa nyams su len pa'o //
translated: The nature of great wisdom has two [aspects]: what is to be known and the practice of meditation.

original: bslab pa shes par bya ba la gnyis te /
analyzed: bslab pa shes par bya ba la gnyis te /
translated: What is to be known in the training has two [aspects]:

original: de kho na nyid bshad pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa'i cha dbye ba'o ;
analyzed: de kho na nyid bshad pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa'i cha dbye ba'o ;
translated: the explanation of reality and the divisions of the aspect of presentation.

original: / de kho na nyid la gnyis te /
analyzed: / de kho na nyid la gnyis te /
translated: Reality has two [aspects]:

original: ye shes dang chos nyid do //
analyzed: ye shes dang chos nyid do //
translated: wisdom and dharmatā.

original: ye shes la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: ye shes la yang gnyis te /
translated: Wisdom also has two [aspects]:

original: lus la ye shes chen po gnas //🔽zhes pa rten bstan pa dang / lus gnas lus las ma skyes pa //
analyzed: lus la ye shes chen po gnas // zhes pa rten bstan pa dang / lus gnas lus las ma skyes pa //
translated: The great pristine consciousness abides in the body.

original: zhes pa'i tshul lam mtshan nyid rang 'byung ye shes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshul lam mtshan nyid rang 'byung ye shes su bstan pa'o //
translated: This explains the support and the mode or characteristic of the pristine consciousness that arises from the body.🔽Dharmatā

original: chos nyid la gnyis te /
analyzed: chos nyid la gnyis te /
translated: There are two in dharmatā:🔽The statement “pervading all things” explains the support, and

original: dngos po kun la khyab ces pas rten bstan pa dang / rtog pa thams cad yang dag spangs //
analyzed: dngos po kun la khyab ces pas rten bstan pa dang / rtog pa thams cad yang dag spangs //

analyzed: zhes pa tshul lam mtshan nyid 'dus ma byas te de bzhin nyid bstan pa'o //

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i cha dbye ba la bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i cha dbye ba la bzhi ste /

original: tshig dang pos rten bstan pa dang / rtog pa gnyis pas mtshon nyid dang / gsum pas yon tan dang / bzhi pas de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin skye med du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig dang pos rten bstan pa dang / rtog pa gnyis pas mtshon nyid dang / gsum pas yon tan dang / bzhi pas de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin skye med du bstan pa'o //
translated: The first word explains the support, the second word explains the characteristic, the third explains the qualities, and the fourth explains the nature of suchness as nonarisen.

original: bsgom pa nyams su len pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: bsgom pa nyams su len pa la gnyis te /
translated: There are two in the practice of meditation:

analyzed: mngon rtogs lam du byas pa dang / 'bras bu lam du byas pa'o //

analyzed: mngon rtogs lam du byas pa la gsum ste /

analyzed: chags can dang @246b chags bral dang phyag rgya chen po'o //

translated: The passionate is based on the wisdom consort of another’s body.🔽“

analyzed: dngos po kun la khyab pa po ni mtshon bya lhan skyes don dam bde ba la mi rtog pa dang kun rdzob zhu ba dang dbyer med rang yang dag par rig pa'o //

original: lus gnas lus las ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: lus gnas lus las ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The body is the basis, and the body is not produced.”

original: zhes pa ni mtshan bya lhan skyes la 'jug chu tshol gsal byed kyi rgyus 'jug gi /'dus byas kyi skyed par byed pa'i rgyus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtshan bya lhan skyes la 'jug chu tshol gsal byed kyi rgyus 'jug gi /'dus byas kyi skyed par byed pa'i rgyus ni ma yin no //
translated: This is the illustration, the connate, which is entered through the cause of the elucidator, not through the cause that produces the compounded.

original: chags bral ni rang lus thabs ldan dam tshig phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: chags bral ni rang lus thabs ldan dam tshig phyag rgya ste /
translated: The free of passion is the pledge seal of the method of one’s own body.

original: de yang lus la zhes pa ni lte bar rtsa gsum 'dus pa gru gsum skye gnas su'o //
analyzed: de yang lus la zhes pa ni lte bar rtsa gsum 'dus pa gru gsum skye gnas su'o //
translated: Also, in the body means in the secret place, where the three channels come together.

original: ye shes ni don dam mtshon byed bde ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni don dam mtshon byed bde ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is the bliss that illustrates the ultimate.

original: gnas zhes pa ni kun rdzob mtshon byed zhu ba'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes pa ni kun rdzob mtshon byed zhu ba'o //

original: yang na ye shes ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: yang na ye shes ni bde ba'o //

original: chen po ni spyi bo bde chen gyi gnas so //
analyzed: chen po ni spyi bo bde chen gyi gnas so //
translated: Great is the place of great bliss at the crown.🔽Place is the descent of the melting bliss.

original: gnas zhes pa zhu ba bde ba dang bcas pas 'bab ste lte bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes pa zhu ba bde ba dang bcas pas 'bab ste lte bar gnas pa'o //
translated: It is located at the navel.

original: rtog pa thams cad yang dag spangs //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad yang dag spangs //
translated: Totally abandoning all concepts,

original: zhes pa ni mtshon byed pa dbyer med de /
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtshon byed pa dbyer med de /
translated: means the inseparability of the illustrated and the illustration.

original: rtog pa rang shugs su spyod cing mi rtog pa rang rnal du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa rang shugs su spyod cing mi rtog pa rang rnal du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Concepts are naturally abandoned, and nonconceptuality is naturally engaged.

original: dngos po kun la khyab pa po //
analyzed: dngos po kun la khyab pa po //
translated: Pervading all things,

original: zhes pa ni mtshon bya lhan skyes don dam bde ba la mi rtog pa dang / kun rdzob zhu ba dang dbyer med rang rig pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtshon bya lhan skyes don dam bde ba la mi rtog pa dang / kun rdzob zhu ba dang dbyer med rang rig pa'o //
translated: means the connate illustrated, the nonconceptual ultimate bliss, and the relative melting, inseparable in one's awareness.

analyzed: lus gnas lus las ma skyes zhes pa ni mtshon bya lhan skyes la 'jug tshul gsal byed kyi rgyu yin te /
translated: The phrase “abiding in the body, not born from the body” is the cause that clarifies the way of engaging the innate object of expression.

original: skyed byed kyi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: skyed byed kyi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: It is not the cause that generates.

original: phyag rgya chen po la gnyis te chags bral lta bu dang / chags can lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la gnyis te chags bral lta bu dang / chags can lta bu'o //
translated: There are two types of mahāmudrā: the one like a detached person and the one like an attached person.

original: de la chags bral lta bu de nyid mchog gi rnam 'phrul ni /
analyzed: de la chags bral lta bu de nyid mchog gi rnam 'phrul ni /
translated: Among those, the supreme emanation is the one like a detached person.

original: de yang / dngos po kun la khyab pa po //
analyzed: de yang / dngos po kun la khyab pa po //
translated: Moreover, “pervading all things”

original: zhes pa ni don skye med kyis khyab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni don skye med kyis khyab pa'o //
translated: means pervaded by the meaning of nonarising.

original: lus la ye shes chen po gnas //
analyzed: lus la ye shes chen po gnas //
translated: “The great wisdom abides in the body”

original: zhes pa ni shes byed kyi don yang don dam pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes byed kyi don yang don dam pa'i ye shes so //
translated: means that the object of knowledge is also ultimate wisdom.

original: rtog pa thams cad yang dag spangs //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad yang dag spangs //
translated: “Correctly abandoning all conceptuality”

original: zhes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye med du go ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye med du go ba'o //
translated: means understanding dependent origination as nonarising.

analyzed: lus gnas lus las ma skyes zhes pa ni shes bya ye shes de nyid kyang skye med du gcig par @247a * //
translated: The phrase “abiding in the body, not born from the body” means that the object of knowledge and wisdom are the same in being nonarisen.

original: gyur pa'o // de la chags can lta bu ni gnyug ma'i lus te de yang lus zhes pa ni gnyug ma de nyid la'o //
analyzed: gyur pa'o // de la chags can lta bu ni gnyug ma'i lus te de yang lus zhes pa ni gnyug ma de nyid la'o //
translated: The “one who is attached” is the innate body, and that is also the “body” of the innate.

original: ye shes chen po ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes chen po ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: “Great wisdom” is uncontaminated wisdom.

original: gnas zhes pa ni zhu ba bsdus pas rtag pa mi 'gyur bar gnas pa nyid do //🔽rtog pa thams cad yang dag spangs //
analyzed: gnas zhes pa ni zhu ba bsdus pas rtag pa mi 'gyur bar gnas pa nyid do // rtog pa thams cad yang dag spangs //
translated: “Abides” means that it abides as permanent and unchanging through the gathering of the melted bodhicitta.

original: zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po mtshon byed rang rig ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po mtshon byed rang rig ste /
translated: “All concepts are totally abandoned” means that the great seal is the indicator of the self-awareness.

original: rtog pa rang shugs su gcod pa dang mi rtog par rang rnal du 'jug pa'o //🔽dngos po kun la khyab ces pa ni dbang po rang snang la sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: rtog pa rang shugs su gcod pa dang mi rtog par rang rnal du 'jug pa'o // dngos po kun la khyab ces pa ni dbang po rang snang la sbyar ba'am /
translated: “Concepts are naturally eliminated” and “nonconceptuality naturally settles in its own state.”

original: mtshon bya lhan skyes so //🔽lus gnas lus las ma skyes pa ni gnyug ma'i lus la gnas kyang tha mal gyi lus las ma skyes pa'am /
analyzed: mtshon bya lhan skyes so // lus gnas lus las ma skyes pa ni gnyug ma'i lus la gnas kyang tha mal gyi lus las ma skyes pa'am /
translated: “Pervades all things” is applied to the self-appearance of the sense organs or the connate object of indication.

original: gsal byed kyi rgyu yin gyi skyed byed kyi rgyu ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsal byed kyi rgyu yin gyi skyed byed kyi rgyu ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Abides in the body, not born from the body” means that it abides in the innate body but is not born from the ordinary body or is the cause of the clarifier but is not the cause of generation.

original: 'bras bu lam du byas pa ni sku bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu lam du byas pa ni sku bzhi ste /
translated: “The result is taken into the path” refers to the four kāyas.

original: tshig dang po longs sku'o //
analyzed: tshig dang po longs sku'o //

original: tshig gnyis pa ni chos sku'o //
analyzed: tshig gnyis pa ni chos sku'o //

original: gsum pa sprul sku'o //
analyzed: gsum pa sprul sku'o //

original: bzhi pa ni bde ba chen po'i sku'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bde ba chen po'i sku'o //

analyzed: rten rdo rje'i lus bstan pa ni lus la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

original: rdo rje snying pos gsol pa zhes pa /
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos gsol pa zhes pa /

analyzed: kye rdo rje'i lus la rtsa du lags /
translated: “In the vajra body, how many channels are there?”

original: zhes pa ni dgyes pa'i rdo rjer 'brel lo //🔽kun brtags kyi lus la kun brtags kyi rtsa du mchis pa dang / gzhan dbang gi lus la gzhan dbang gi rtsa du mchis pa dang / yongs grub kyi lus la yong grub kyi rtsa du mchis zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dgyes pa'i rdo rjer 'brel lo // kun brtags kyi lus la kun brtags kyi rtsa du mchis pa dang / gzhan dbang gi lus la gzhan dbang gi rtsa du mchis pa dang / yongs grub kyi lus la yong grub kyi rtsa du mchis zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is connected to the Hevajra Tantra.🔽The thought is, “In the imagined body, how many imagined channels are there? In the dependent body, how many dependent channels are there? In the perfected body, how many perfected channels are there?”

analyzed: lan du rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis te phyir len btab ste kun brtags kyi lus la rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /

analyzed: mi phyed ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis 'bab pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar te rnal 'byor gyi kun rdzob po //

original: kun brtags kyi lus la yang sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi lus la yang sum cu rtsa gnyis te /

original: yang mi phyed ma dang phra gzugs ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang mi phyed ma dang phra gzugs ma la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: khams dang nye ba'i khams bskyed pa'o //

analyzed: de la rnam par gzhag pa'i ni grangs dang las dang so so'i mtshan nyid dang gnas dang / gtso bo dang / phal bar dbye ba'o //

analyzed: de la grangs ni sum cu rtsa gnyis te /

original: mi phyed ma dang phra gzugs ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi phyed ma dang phra gzugs ma la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: de ni rnam par gzhag pa'o //
