analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid du ni brtag / ces pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i chos kun te gnyis sbyor ba las byung ba'i lha'i 'khor lor brtags shing snang ba'o //
translated: in the wheel of the deity that arises from the union of all phenomena, such as the aggregates, and is imagined and appears.

original: de la rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang gzhan lus shes rab la brten pa dang / rang lus thabs dang ldan pa dang dbyer med phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: de la rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang gzhan lus shes rab la brten pa dang / rang lus thabs dang ldan pa dang dbyer med phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: The perfection stage is also threefold: based on the wisdom of another’s body, endowed with the method of one’s own body, and the great seal of inseparability.

original: shes rab la brten pa yang /
analyzed: shes rab la brten pa yang /
translated: Based on the wisdom of another’s body,

original: srid gsum yongs gyur thams cad ni //
analyzed: srid gsum yongs gyur thams cad ni //
translated: the verse beginning “All of the three worlds”

original: zhes pa ni shes rab ma'i gsang ba'i gnas te rtsa gsum yongs su gyur pa'i bya rog gi gdong can no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes rab ma'i gsang ba'i gnas te rtsa gsum yongs su gyur pa'i bya rog gi gdong can no //
translated: refers to the secret place of the wisdom woman, the three channels transformed into the crow-faced goddess.

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
translated: “ Abandoning the apprehended and the apprehender”

original: zhes pa ni de'i nang khong stong gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de'i nang khong stong gi rnam pa'o //
translated: refers to the hollow nature of her abdomen.

original: yang na ni aa tha ste de nas so //
analyzed: yang na ni aa tha ste de nas so //
translated: Alternatively, atha means “from there.”

original: thams cad ni lus thams cad do //
analyzed: thams cad ni lus thams cad do //
translated: “ All” refers to the entire body.

original: thabs ni rin po che'i ze 'bru'i bde ba gnas pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: thabs ni rin po che'i ze 'bru'i bde ba gnas pa'i thabs so //
translated: “ Method” is the method of abiding in the bliss of the jewel center.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid du ni brtag / ces pa ni dngos po zhu ba dang mtshan nyid bde ba lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo bla ma'i man ngag ni bsgom pas brtag pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid du ni brtag / ces pa ni dngos po zhu ba dang mtshan nyid bde ba lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo bla ma'i man ngag ni bsgom pas brtag pa'o //
translated: “ The characteristics of entities are imagined” means that the melting of entities and the characteristics of the essence of the innate bliss are imagined through meditation on the guru’s instruction.

original: de la rang lus thabs dang ldan pa'i ni srid pa gsum gyi rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la rang lus thabs dang ldan pa'i ni srid pa gsum gyi rtsa gsum mo //
translated: The “own body endowed with means” is the three channels of the three existences.

original: yongs gyur ni skye gnas gru gsum mo //
analyzed: yongs gyur ni skye gnas gru gsum mo //
translated: “ Transformation” is the triangular birth place.

original: thams cad de lus kun 'dus pa'o //🔽gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spang //
analyzed: thams cad de lus kun 'dus pa'o // gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spang //
translated: “ All” is the gathering of the whole body.

original: zhes pa ni nang khong stong lta bu'am /
analyzed: zhes pa ni nang khong stong lta bu'am /
translated: “ Abandoning the apprehended and the apprehender” is like the inside being empty.

original: yang na 'og na gnas pa shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: yang na 'og na gnas pa shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: Or, since the one below is the nature of wisdom,

original: aa tha ni aa kra ste de la'o //
analyzed: aa tha ni aa kra ste de la'o //
translated: “atha” is “akra” in that.

original: thabs ni bde ba chen po'i gnas so //
analyzed: thabs ni bde ba chen po'i gnas so //
translated: “ Means” is the place of great bliss.

original: thams cad ni lus kun zhu ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni lus kun zhu ba'o //
translated: “ All” is the melting of the whole body.🔽“ The characteristic of entity” is the imagination of what is not real.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid du ni brtag / ces pa snga ma ltar lhan cig skyes pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid du ni brtag / ces pa snga ma ltar lhan cig skyes pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the connate is as before.

original: gnyis med phyag rgya chen po la gnyis te /
analyzed: gnyis med phyag rgya chen po la gnyis te /
translated: The great seal of nonduality has two parts:

original: brten pa chos la 'jug pa dang / rten nang nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: brten pa chos la 'jug pa dang / rten nang nas 'jug pa'o //
translated: engaging the phenomena that are the support and engaging the inner support.

original: brten pa chos la 'jug pa ni shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: brten pa chos la 'jug pa ni shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Engaging the phenomena that are the support is the inseparability of wisdom and means.

original: de la shes rab ni srid gsum ste khams gsum mo //
analyzed: de la shes rab ni srid gsum ste khams gsum mo //
translated: Therein, “wisdom” is the three existences, that is, the three realms.

original: yongs gyur ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i sbyor bas rang bzhin med pas thams cad yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yongs gyur ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i sbyor bas rang bzhin med pas thams cad yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The transformation is the absence of intrinsic nature, because of the application of being free from one and many, and so everything is transformed.

original: de la shes rab kyi ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How is that viewed by wisdom?🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spang //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spang // zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is free from apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: de la thabs kyi ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: de la thabs kyi ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How is that viewed by method?

original: pha rol phyin pa'i theg pa ltar gcig dang du bral @248b la sogs pa sbyor ba la mi ltos pas aa tha ba ste /
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa'i theg pa ltar gcig dang du bral @248b la sogs pa sbyor ba la mi ltos pas aa tha ba ste /
translated: Since it does not depend on the application of being free from one and many, and so on, as in the Pāramitāyāna, it is ābhā, meaning “without.”

original: rnam grangs sam thabs snang ba'i bdag nyid pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid du brtag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs sam thabs snang ba'i bdag nyid pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid du brtag pa'o //
translated: The Pāramitāyāna is a synonym or method that appears as the nature of the phenomena of the immeasurables, and so on.🔽Again,

original: yang na / srid gsum yongs gyur thams cad ni //
analyzed: yang na / srid gsum yongs gyur thams cad ni //
translated: all transformations of the three existences

original: zhes pa ni lus ngag yid gsum gyi khams gnyug ma'i aa wa dh'u t'i des bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lus ngag yid gsum gyi khams gnyug ma'i aa wa dh'u t'i des bsdus pa'o //
translated: are the three existences of body, voice, and mind included in the fundamental dhātu of avadhūti.

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spang //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spang //
translated: Free from apprehendeds and apprehenders

original: zhes pa ni der skyes pa'i ye shes kyi rtog pa gcod cing mi rtog pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni der skyes pa'i ye shes kyi rtog pa gcod cing mi rtog pa skye ba'o //
translated: This is the cutting off of the conceptualization of gnosis born there, and the arising of non-conceptuality.

original: thabs ni zhes pa ni bde ba'i ror rang snang bas mi rtog pa rang rnal du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni zhes pa ni bde ba'i ror rang snang bas mi rtog pa rang rnal du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The method is the entry into the natural state of non-conceptuality through the self-appearance of the taste of bliss.

original: thams cad kyi zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med do //
analyzed: thams cad kyi zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med do //
translated: All means the inseparability of method and wisdom.

original: de lta bu'i ye shes chen po de gang du gnas shing brten zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ye shes chen po de gang du gnas shing brten zhe na /
translated: If it is asked where that great gnosis is located and supported,

original: de'i phyir / dngos po'i mtshan nyid du ni brtag / ces pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dngos po'i mtshan nyid du ni brtag / ces pa ste /
translated: it is said, “It is investigated in the characteristic of entities.”

original: dngos po ni bstan du med la thogs pa med pa'i gzugs gnyug ma'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni bstan du med la thogs pa med pa'i gzugs gnyug ma'i dbang po'o //
translated: Entities are the intrinsic sense faculty, which is a form that is not demonstrable and is unimpeded.

original: mtshan nyid ni der gnas pa'i ye shes chen po'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni der gnas pa'i ye shes chen po'o //
translated: The characteristic is the great gnosis that is located there.🔽It is said, “It is investigated.”

original: du ni brtag ces pa ste dbang po rang snang ba dang ye shes rang 'bar ba'i man ngag go //
analyzed: du ni brtag ces pa ste dbang po rang snang ba dang ye shes rang 'bar ba'i man ngag go //
translated: The intimate instruction is the self-appearance of the sense organ and the self-arisen gnosis.

original: de rnams la cho ga kha bskang ba snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de rnams la cho ga kha bskang ba snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The rite of those is the same as before.

original: de rnams kyi rtags ni gsum ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rtags ni gsum ste /
translated: The signs of those are three.

original: mi 'gyur ba ni lta ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba ni lta ba'i rtags so //
translated: The sign of the view is the unchanging.

original: dngos po kun la chags med drod //
analyzed: dngos po kun la chags med drod //
translated: Heat is non-attachment to all things.

original: 'jig rten chos brgyad spangs pa ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten chos brgyad spangs pa ni //
translated: Abandoning the eight worldly concerns

original: spyod pa'i rtags su shes par bya //
analyzed: spyod pa'i rtags su shes par bya //
translated: is to be known as the sign of practice.

original: zhes pa'o // sdom pa'i dbye ba la don gnyis te /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // sdom pa'i dbye ba la don gnyis te /
translated: The divisions of the vows have two topics:

original: bshad tshul sbyar ba dang brtag pa phyi ma'i rgyu mtshan btu ba'o //
analyzed: bshad tshul sbyar ba dang brtag pa phyi ma'i rgyu mtshan btu ba'o //
translated: the application of the method of explanation and the collection of reasons for the later investigation.

original: bshad tshul sbyar ba la yang don gsum ste /
analyzed: bshad tshul sbyar ba la yang don gsum ste /
translated: The application of the method of explanation has three topics:

original: nges pa'i tshig dang bshad tshul dbye ba dang mngon par rtogs pa'o ;
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig dang bshad tshul dbye ba dang mngon par rtogs pa'o ;
translated: the verbal definition, the divisions of the method of explanation, and the clear realization.

original: / nges pa'i tshig la gsum ste /
analyzed: / nges pa'i tshig la gsum ste /
translated: The verbal definition has three topics:

original: mang ba nyung bar sdom pa dang / phyi rol lus la sdom pa dang / bde ba chen po'i mchog tu bstim pa'o //
analyzed: mang ba nyung bar sdom pa dang / phyi rol lus la sdom pa dang / bde ba chen po'i mchog tu bstim pa'o //
translated: the many are condensed into the few, the external body is condensed, and the supreme of great bliss is condensed.

original: yang gang gis sdom pa dang gang du sdom pa yang yang dag par sdom pa'o //
analyzed: yang gang gis sdom pa dang gang du sdom pa yang yang dag par sdom pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the vows are condensed by whom and where the vows are perfectly condensed.

original: de la mang ba la nyung bar sdom pa ni thabs dang shes rab la sdom pa dang / lus ngag yid gsum la sdom pa'o //
analyzed: de la mang ba la nyung bar sdom pa ni thabs dang shes rab la sdom pa dang / lus ngag yid gsum la sdom pa'o //
translated: Among those, the many are condensed into the few, the vows of method and wisdom are condensed, and the vows of body, voice, and mind are condensed.

original: phyi rol lus la sdom pa ni 'khor lo bzhi la sdom pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol lus la sdom pa ni 'khor lo bzhi la sdom pa'o //
translated: The “outer body” is the binding of the four wheels.

original: bde ba mchog tu sdom pa ni dga' ba dang skad cig go //
analyzed: bde ba mchog tu sdom pa ni dga' ba dang skad cig go //
translated: The “supreme bliss” is the binding of joy and the moment.

original: bshad tshul dbye ba la gnyis te /
analyzed: bshad tshul dbye ba la gnyis te /
translated: The explanation of the divisions is twofold:

original: bskyed pa ltar sbyar ba dang rdzogs rim mo //
analyzed: bskyed pa ltar sbyar ba dang rdzogs rim mo //
translated: the application according to the creation stage and the completion stage.

original: bskyed pa lha la gnyis @249a * //
analyzed: bskyed pa lha la gnyis @249a * //
translated: The creation stage has two parts:

original: te ; lam cho ga dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: te ; lam cho ga dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: the path and the result.

original: de la lam ni a'a li k'a li yongs su gyur pa las zla ba dang nyi ma'o //
analyzed: de la lam ni a'a li k'a li yongs su gyur pa las zla ba dang nyi ma'o //
translated: The path is the moon and sun from the transformation of the vowels and consonants.

original: shes rab dang thabs so //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs so //
translated: They are wisdom and method.

original: des ni chos kun bsdus shing dbye bas sdom pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: des ni chos kun bsdus shing dbye bas sdom pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: Since all phenomena are included in those two, the division of the binding is the division of phenomena.

original: 'bras bu yang sku gsum dang rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang sku gsum dang rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: The result is the three bodies and the three vajras.

original: der lha kun gyi 'bras bu 'dus pas sdom pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: der lha kun gyi 'bras bu 'dus pas sdom pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: Since all the results of all deities are included in those, the division of the binding is the division of the result.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gsum ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gsum ste /
translated: The completion stage has three parts:

original: gzhan lus shes rab la brten pa dang rang lus thabs dang ldan pa dang de kho na nyid dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan lus shes rab la brten pa dang rang lus thabs dang ldan pa dang de kho na nyid dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: the path of the dependent origination of the body of another, the method of the body of oneself, and the application of reality.

original: de yang gzhan lus shes rab la sbyar ba ni ae wam ma y'a lha mo bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang gzhan lus shes rab la sbyar ba ni ae wam ma y'a lha mo bzhi ste /
translated: Moreover, the application of the wisdom of another's body is the four goddesses E, Vam, Ma, and Ya.

original: de nyid phyag rgya bzhi'am lhan skyes la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma bzhi'o //
analyzed: de nyid phyag rgya bzhi'am lhan skyes la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma bzhi'o //
translated: That itself is the four seals or the four yoginis of the innate, etc.

original: des na rten thams cad der 'dus pas sdom pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: des na rten thams cad der 'dus pas sdom pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: Therefore, since all the bases are included there, it is the divisions of the vows.

original: rang lus dang thabs dang ldan pa ni 'khor lo bzhi'i 'dab ma'i grangs dang rnam pa ste /
analyzed: rang lus dang thabs dang ldan pa ni 'khor lo bzhi'i 'dab ma'i grangs dang rnam pa ste /
translated: The application of one's own body and method is the number and aspect of the petals of the four chakras.

original: der lus kun 'dus pas sdom pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: der lus kun 'dus pas sdom pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: Since the entire body is included there, it is the divisions of the vows.

original: de kho na nyid dang sbyar ba la yang thun mong dang khyad par ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid dang sbyar ba la yang thun mong dang khyad par ro //
translated: The application of reality is also common and special.

original: thun mong ni bden pa bzhi dang sde pa bzhi ste sde pa mchog tu sdom pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ni bden pa bzhi dang sde pa bzhi ste sde pa mchog tu sdom pa'o //
translated: The common is the four truths and the four orders, which are the supreme order of vows.

original: khyad par ni mchog dang mchog ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par ni mchog dang mchog ma yin pa ste /
translated: The special is supreme and non-supreme.

original: de yang mchog ni skad cig dang dga' ba bzhi'i bde ba mchog tu sdom pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mchog ni skad cig dang dga' ba bzhi'i bde ba mchog tu sdom pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the supreme is the bliss of the four moments and four joys, which is the supreme vow.

original: mchog ma yin pa ni de kho na nyid bzhi bde ba mchog tu sdom pas sdom pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: mchog ma yin pa ni de kho na nyid bzhi bde ba mchog tu sdom pas sdom pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: The non-supreme is the bliss of the four realities, which is the vow of the supreme vow.

original: brtag pa phyi ma'i tshul du rgyu mtshan bstan pa la gnyis te yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma'i tshul du rgyu mtshan bstan pa la gnyis te yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas so //
translated: The explanation of the reasons in the manner of the later examination has two parts: the utterly pure perfect Buddha and the Buddha.

original: de la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni 'khor lo bzhi sku bzhir grub pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni 'khor lo bzhi sku bzhir grub pa ste /
translated: Therein, the utterly pure perfect Buddha is the accomplishment of the four wheels as the four bodies.

original: 'bras bu bzhi dang sde pa bzhi dang ; rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sde pa mchog tu sdom pa dang / sangs rgyas ni sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi dang sde pa bzhi dang ; rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sde pa mchog tu sdom pa dang / sangs rgyas ni sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: The Buddha is the bodhisattva of the ten stages, who is the supreme vow of the four results, the four divisions, and the reason for the arrangement.

original: mir skye ba dag pa'i tshul gdod ma nas sangs rgyas yin pas bde ba mchog tu sdom pas sdom pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: mir skye ba dag pa'i tshul gdod ma nas sangs rgyas yin pas bde ba mchog tu sdom pas sdom pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: The division of the vows is the supreme bliss of the vow of the pure way of birth as a human, because of being a Buddha from the beginning.

original: mngon par rtogs pa la gnyis te ;
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa la gnyis te ;
translated: There are two topics in the clear realization:

original: / rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po steng sgo rlung la bslabs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por byang chub sems la bslab pa'o //
analyzed: / rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po steng sgo rlung la bslabs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por byang chub sems la bslab pa'o //
translated: the training in the upper vāyu for the antidote of conceptuality and the training in bodhicitta for the antidote of affliction.

original: rlung la gnyis te /
analyzed: rlung la gnyis te /
translated: There are two topics in the vāyu:

original: shes par bya ba dang / bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: shes par bya ba dang / bsgom pa'o //
translated: the vāyu to be understood and the vāyu to be cultivated.

original: de la shes pa ni phyi dag par shes pa dang nang dag par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la shes pa ni phyi dag par shes pa dang nang dag par shes pa'o //
translated: Therein, consciousness is the consciousness of the external purity and the consciousness of the internal purity.

original: de la phyi ni rgyal @249b po'i pho brang dang dge 'dun gyi gnas dag na dbyu gu dang chu tshod la sogs te rlung du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de la phyi ni rgyal @249b po'i pho brang dang dge 'dun gyi gnas dag na dbyu gu dang chu tshod la sogs te rlung du sbyar ba'o //
translated: Therein, the external is the application to the wind of the gnomon and the water clock, etc. in the king's palace and the community's dwelling.

original: nang gi lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo la sogs pa 'dab ma'i grangs sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo la sogs pa 'dab ma'i grangs sbyar ba'o //
translated: The internal is the application to the number of petals in the nāḍīs of the navel, secret place, and so on.

original: de dag rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du shes nas rlung la bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: de dag rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du shes nas rlung la bsgom pa ste /
translated: Having understood those to be the nature of purity, one meditates on the vāyu.

original: zla ba nyid ma a'a li k'a li nyin mtshan gnyis la thun bzhi bzhi brgyad du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zla ba nyid ma a'a li k'a li nyin mtshan gnyis la thun bzhi bzhi brgyad du 'byung ngo //
translated: The moon and sun are the four periods of day and night.

original: re mos 'byung ba'i 'pho ba ni thun phyed phyed nas te bcu drug go //
analyzed: re mos 'byung ba'i 'pho ba ni thun phyed phyed nas te bcu drug go //
translated: The transits that occur in sequence are the sixteen half-periods.

original: de re re la yang thabs dang shes rab kyi chas chus tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: de re re la yang thabs dang shes rab kyi chas chus tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: Each of those has thirty-two finger lengths of method and wisdom.

original: yang zla nyi gang yang rung ba gcig las byung ba bzhi rim gyis 'byung bas dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang zla nyi gang yang rung ba gcig las byung ba bzhi rim gyis 'byung bas dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Also, since the four movements arise from either the moon or the sun in sequence, there are sixty-four finger lengths.

original: de ltar rlung las su rung nas grangs kyi rtsis ni gzhan du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rlung las su rung nas grangs kyi rtsis ni gzhan du shes par bya'o //
translated: As such, having become serviceable in the vāyu, the calculation of the number should be understood elsewhere.

original: bslabs pa ni grangs la bcu dang brgya'i bar du bslab pa dang / rlung lhan cig skyes par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bslabs pa ni grangs la bcu dang brgya'i bar du bslab pa dang / rlung lhan cig skyes par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The training is the training in the number up to ten thousand and the union with the connate vāyu.

original: byang chub sems la bslab pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems la bslab pa la gnyis te /
translated: The training in bodhicitta has two topics:

original: sgra'i dbye ba dang bshad tshul sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i dbye ba dang bshad tshul sbyor ba'o //

analyzed: bsregs pa ni tha mal pa mi dmigs par 'ju bar byed pa'o //

original: ri bong can ni zhu ba'o ;
analyzed: ri bong can ni zhu ba'o ;

analyzed: / ham ni bde ba chen po'i gnas la yod pa'o //

analyzed: 'dzag pa ni de la rgyu ba'o //

analyzed: rnam pa dang don dang ming rnams kyang bsregs pa'o //

translated: Having burned the forms, meanings, and names of the eyes and so on in the throat, they emerge from the brow and draw the light rays of the tathāgatas into the haṃ.🔽Since the haṃ becomes partless and partless, the thirty-two channels of bliss arise.

original: byas te dri chen bu gnas byung nas /
analyzed: byas te dri chen bu gnas byung nas /

analyzed: de nas mgrin par song ste ngal bsos rang gi yi ge rnams gsos /

analyzed: btsun mo rgyan gyis brgyan pa 'dod pas gdungs pa la tshim par byas pa ltar bde ba dang dga' bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: a'am l'i ni mo rtags te shes rab lha mo bla na med pa'o //

analyzed: lte ba ni sa'i dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i 'khor lo dang nam mkha'i dkyil bde chen gyi 'khor lo lte bar zug cing gnas pa'o //

analyzed: bsregs pa ni zhu ba'i thig ler dbyer med pas rdo rje sems dpar gyur pa'o //

analyzed: ri bong can ni rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi ming gi rnam grangs so //

analyzed: dgra sta'i gzugs cig byas la /
translated: out of the wood of the weapon tree.

original: badzra ku sh'a ra sgrub pa'i don du khri bzlas shing bsgrub pa las sbyor gyi dus su de brdar la dpral bar thig le byas la /
analyzed: badzra ku sh'a ra sgrub pa'i don du khri bzlas shing bsgrub pa las sbyor gyi dus su de brdar la dpral bar thig le byas la /
translated: For the purpose of accomplishing Vajrakumāra, one should perform the preliminary propitiation of ten thousand recitations. At the time of the rite of application, one should sharpen that [hatchet] and make a bindu on one's forehead.

original: lha gang la phyag byas pa de 'gas zhes pa ni dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'i lha rten la sta re dmigs la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: lha gang la phyag byas pa de 'gas zhes pa ni dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'i lha rten la sta re dmigs la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: One should pay homage to whichever deity one has taken refuge in. This means one should pay homage to the deity's shrine, such as Maheśvara, visualizing a hatchet.

original: bsnyen pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsnyen pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The preliminary practice is as before.

original: nang ni tshangs pa'i sa bon ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: nang ni tshangs pa'i sa bon ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Internally, the seed of Brahmā is the mind of enlightenment.

original: rgyal la sgrub pa ni lhan cig pa'i dus so //
analyzed: rgyal la sgrub pa ni lhan cig pa'i dus so //
translated: The accomplishment in the king is at the time of coitus.

original: ku sh'a ratstshinna ni byang chub sems kyi rim gro'o //
analyzed: ku sh'a ratstshinna ni byang chub sems kyi rim gro'o //
translated: The rite of the kuśa grass is the service of the mind of enlightenment.

original: mi bskyod pa btags pa ni brdung ba'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa btags pa ni brdung ba'o //
translated: The consecration of Akṣobhya is the striking.

original: nyi ma gzas zin pa ni rang byung gi me tog go //
analyzed: nyi ma gzas zin pa ni rang byung gi me tog go //
translated: The sun is eclipsed is the naturally arisen flower.

original: dgra sta ni gcod pas na dgra sta ste rkang pas mnan pa dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: dgra sta ni gcod pas na dgra sta ste rkang pas mnan pa dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: The axe is an axe because it cuts, like the foot that treads on it,

original: 'og tu 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: 'og tu 'joms pa'o //
translated: it is below.

original: bzlas pa ni yang dang yang du bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bzlas pa ni yang dang yang du bsgom pa ste /
translated: The repetition is the meditation again and again.

original: lha gang la phyag byas pa ni dngos po gzugs la sogs pa dngos po la zhen pa gang yang rung bde 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: lha gang la phyag byas pa ni dngos po gzugs la sogs pa dngos po la zhen pa gang yang rung bde 'joms pa'o //
translated: The deity to whom homage is paid is any attachment to things such as form, etc.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The rest is easy to understand and is not explained.

original: rdo rje ma dang @253a * //
analyzed: rdo rje ma dang @253a * //
translated: The Vajra Lady, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gong gi rengs pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma re re dang lha re re sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gong gi rengs pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma re re dang lha re re sbyar ro //
translated: Each of the above yogamas, such as the Paralysis Lady, is to be applied to each deity.

original: brtul zhugs can zhes pa ste bskyed pa'i rim pa la mtshan ma thob par bya'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs can zhes pa ste bskyed pa'i rim pa la mtshan ma thob par bya'o //
translated: The one who is disciplined is to obtain the sign in the creation stage.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la rang gi nyams thob nas bag tsha ba med pas bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la rang gi nyams thob nas bag tsha ba med pas bya'o //
translated: Having attained one's own experience in the completion stage, one should act without hesitation.

original: le'u'i mtshan ma yang ;
analyzed: le'u'i mtshan ma yang ;
translated: The name of the chapter is also

original: snga ma ltar ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: snga ma ltar ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: to be applied as appropriate, as before.

original: le'u gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter.

original: // / de nas lha'i le'u bshad par bya zhes pa ni lha ste /
analyzed: // / de nas lha'i le'u bshad par bya zhes pa ni lha ste /
translated: Now, the chapter on the deities will be explained. The deities are

original: lus las byung ba dang / bde ba la rol pa ste lha'o //
analyzed: lus las byung ba dang / bde ba la rol pa ste lha'o //
translated: The gods are those who have arisen from the body and those who enjoy bliss.

original: rgyun zhi ba'i don gyis na lha'o //🔽de'i rim pa yang gnyis te phyag gnyis pa la bshad pa dang gzhan la sbyar ba'o ;
analyzed: rgyun zhi ba'i don gyis na lha'o // de'i rim pa yang gnyis te phyag gnyis pa la bshad pa dang gzhan la sbyar ba'o ;
translated: The gods are so called because they have the meaning of continuously pacified.

original: / bshad pa la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: / bshad pa la yang gnyis te /
translated: The sequence of that is twofold: the explanation of the two-armed [form] and the application to the others.

original: dpa' bo gcig pa bskyed pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo gcig pa bskyed pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The explanation is also twofold: the generation of the sole hero and the maṇḍala wheel.

original: de la dpa' bo gcig pa ni /
analyzed: de la dpa' bo gcig pa ni /
translated: The sole hero is as follows:

original: de la sgrub po phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas rang gi snying ga la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis rang mos pa'i rnal 'byor gyi sa bon gyi 'od zer las zhes pa la sogs pa gnas bsrung ba nas brtsams ste /
analyzed: de la sgrub po phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas rang gi snying ga la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis rang mos pa'i rnal 'byor gyi sa bon gyi 'od zer las zhes pa la sogs pa gnas bsrung ba nas brtsams ste /
translated: The adept, endowed with perfection, should recite the verse beginning with “from the light rays of the seed syllable of the yoga of one’s choice” and so on, and beginning with the protection of the place,

original: bya ba'i rim pa rnams mchod pa byin gyis brlab pa yan chad snga ma ltar byas la nam mkhar rje btsun la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang bzhis mchod nas bshags pa la sogs pa yang bya ste /
analyzed: bya ba'i rim pa rnams mchod pa byin gyis brlab pa yan chad snga ma ltar byas la nam mkhar rje btsun la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang bzhis mchod nas bshags pa la sogs pa yang bya ste /
translated: and having performed the stages of the rite up to the consecration of the offerings as before, having offered to the venerable master and so on in the space with four and a half verses, one should also perform the confession, and so on.

original: ci'i phyir tshogs ma bsags par lha mi bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshogs ma bsags par lha mi bsgom zhe na /
translated: Why is it that one does not meditate on the deities without having accumulated the collections?

original: rgyu dang rkyen sngon du ma song bar mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen sngon du ma song bar mi 'byung ste /
translated: Without having gone before as causes and conditions, they do not occur.

original: dper na myu gu sngon po bskyed pa la nyer len gyi rgyu sa bon myu gu lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen chu lud dang drod tshad med par mi 'byung ba ltar /
analyzed: dper na myu gu sngon po bskyed pa la nyer len gyi rgyu sa bon myu gu lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen chu lud dang drod tshad med par mi 'byung ba ltar /
translated: For example, in order to produce a green sprout, the substantial cause is the seed, and the cooperating conditions are water, fertilizer, and temperature.

original: rgyu bsod nams kyi tshogs dang rkyen ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis bsags dgos te /
analyzed: rgyu bsod nams kyi tshogs dang rkyen ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis bsags dgos te /
translated: It is necessary to accumulate the two collections: the collection of merit as the cause and the collection of wisdom as the condition.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa la yang zhing sprul dgos pas de yang lugs bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa la yang zhing sprul dgos pas de yang lugs bzhi ste /
translated: In order to accumulate the collection of merit, it is necessary to emanate the fields and emanations.🔽There are four systems: emanation from the heart, clear arrangement, natural abiding, and invitation.

original: snying gnas sprul pa dang bkod pa gsal ba dang / rang bzhin du gnas pa dang / spyan drangs pa las 'dir spyan drangs pa ste /
analyzed: snying gnas sprul pa dang bkod pa gsal ba dang / rang bzhin du gnas pa dang / spyan drangs pa las 'dir spyan drangs pa ste /
translated: Here, it is the invitation.

original: he ru ka phyag bcu drug pa la lha mo brgyad kyis bskor ba gcig go //
analyzed: he ru ka phyag bcu drug pa la lha mo brgyad kyis bskor ba gcig go //
translated: There is one Heruka with sixteen hands surrounded by eight goddesses.

original: de la mchod pa phyi nang gsang ba de kho na nyid kyis mchod do //
analyzed: de la mchod pa phyi nang gsang ba de kho na nyid kyis mchod do //
translated: One makes offerings to them with outer, inner, and secret offerings and with the offering of suchness.

original: phyi ni spos dang me tog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ni spos dang me tog la sogs pa'o //
translated: The outer goddesses offer incense, flowers, and so forth.

original: nang gi lha mo brgyad po rnams kyis mchod de //
analyzed: nang gi lha mo brgyad po rnams kyis mchod de //
translated: The eight inner goddesses offer:

original: dkar mo ri dags mtshan ma 'dzin //
analyzed: dkar mo ri dags mtshan ma 'dzin //
translated: White holds a deer and a mirror.🔽The skull filled with enlightenment holds the skull in the hand.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub kyis gang ba'i thod pa lag par 'dzin zhes pa ni @253b rgyud kyi tshig zor yang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub kyis gang ba'i thod pa lag par 'dzin zhes pa ni @253b rgyud kyi tshig zor yang du byas pa'o //
translated: The words of the tantra are made light.

original: lag pa zhes pa dang / snod ces pa dang 'dzin pa zhes gong 'og kun la sbyar ro //
analyzed: lag pa zhes pa dang / snod ces pa dang 'dzin pa zhes gong 'og kun la sbyar ro //
translated: The words “hand,” “vessel,” and “holds” are applied to all above and below.

original: bdud las rgyal ba ni rang byung gi rakta'o //
analyzed: bdud las rgyal ba ni rang byung gi rakta'o //
translated: The victory over demons is natural blood.

original: chu ni dri chu'o //
analyzed: chu ni dri chu'o //
translated: Water is urine.

original: sman ni dri chen no //
analyzed: sman ni dri chen no //
translated: Medicine is feces.

original: rdo rje ni sha chen no //
analyzed: rdo rje ni sha chen no //
translated: The vajra is human flesh.

original: ro ni sbrang rtsi ste mtshon pas chang ngo //
analyzed: ro ni sbrang rtsi ste mtshon pas chang ngo //
translated: Taste is honey, and by implication, alcohol.

original: cang te'u ni phyi'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: cang te'u ni phyi'i mchod pa'o //
translated: The hand drum is the outer offering.

original: 'dod chags chen po rjes chags zhes pa ni gsang ba'i mchod pa ste /🔽'dod chags chen po ni gtso bo'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po rjes chags zhes pa ni gsang ba'i mchod pa ste / 'dod chags chen po ni gtso bo'am /
translated: Great passion is the secret offering.🔽Great passion is the principal,

original: rjes chags ni g-yung mo ste /
analyzed: rjes chags ni g-yung mo ste /
translated: or passion is the yoginī.

original: g-yung mos mgul nas 'khyud pa nyid //
analyzed: g-yung mos mgul nas 'khyud pa nyid //
translated: The yoginī embraces the neck.

original: ces pa ni mchod bya'i lha mo rnams gtso bo la bsdu /🔽mchod byed kyi lha mo rnams g-yung mo la bsdu la ;
analyzed: ces pa ni mchod bya'i lha mo rnams gtso bo la bsdu / mchod byed kyi lha mo rnams g-yung mo la bsdu la ;
translated: This means that the offering goddesses are gathered into the principal one.🔽The offering goddesses are gathered into the yoginī.

original: / kun du ru'i rjes su chags pa'am yang na mchod byed kyi lha mo rnams rang la bsdu zhing g-yung mos rlung mtshams na 'khyud pa'i tshul gyis mchod pa'o //
analyzed: / kun du ru'i rjes su chags pa'am yang na mchod byed kyi lha mo rnams rang la bsdu zhing g-yung mos rlung mtshams na 'khyud pa'i tshul gyis mchod pa'o //
translated: Or, the offering goddesses are gathered into oneself, and the yoginī makes offering in the manner of embracing in the northwest.

original: de'i dus su bde ba'i ro nyams su myong ba ni de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dus su bde ba'i ro nyams su myong ba ni de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa'o //
translated: The experience of the taste of bliss at that time is the offering of reality.

original: de'i mdun du bdun rnam dag bya ste /
analyzed: de'i mdun du bdun rnam dag bya ste /
translated: In front of that, one should perform the sevenfold purification.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bla ma rdo rje 'chang mchod cing //🔽bdun pa yongs su dag par bya //
analyzed: bla ma rdo rje 'chang mchod cing // bdun pa yongs su dag par bya //
translated: Make offering to the guru Vajradhara

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: and perform the sevenfold purification.

original: de nas dang por byams pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis tshogs rgyas 'debs te /
analyzed: de nas dang por byams pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis tshogs rgyas 'debs te /
translated: Then, first, one seals the extensive accumulation with one verse of love and so forth.

original: tshig dang po gnyis kyis bsod nams skyi tshogs nus pa dang ldan par byed /
analyzed: tshig dang po gnyis kyis bsod nams skyi tshogs nus pa dang ldan par byed /
translated: The first two lines endow the accumulation of merit with power.

original: tshig 'og ma gnyis kyis ye shes kyi tshogs nus pa dang ldan par byed pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'og ma gnyis kyis ye shes kyi tshogs nus pa dang ldan par byed pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: The next two lines indicate the purpose of the accumulation of wisdom, which is to make one's abilities effective.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni dmigs pa tshad med pas sam /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni dmigs pa tshad med pas sam /
translated: The verbal definition is that it is immeasurable because its object is immeasurable,

original: 'bras bu tshad med thob pas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu tshad med thob pas so //
translated: or because it attains immeasurable results.

original: dbye ba go rims nges pa ni skye ba'i go rims te /
analyzed: dbye ba go rims nges pa ni skye ba'i go rims te /
translated: The order of the sequence is that of their arising.

original: byams pa ni brtse ba dang ldan pa las snying rje skyes pas de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: byams pa ni brtse ba dang ldan pa las snying rje skyes pas de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Loving kindness arises from being full of affection, and compassion arises from loving kindness.

original: dmigs pa'i yul ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / sems can nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du rim par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i yul ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / sems can nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du rim par sbyar ro //
translated: The object of meditation is the sentient beings of the happy realms and the miserable realms, the Sravakas, the Pratyekabuddhas, and the Buddhas.

original: bsgom pa'i thabs ni che 'bring rnam pa dgu ru phye ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i thabs ni che 'bring rnam pa dgu ru phye ste /
translated: The method of meditation is to distinguish nine degrees of greatness.

original: dang po byams pa zhes pa bshes 'brel lta bu ste /
analyzed: dang po byams pa zhes pa bshes 'brel lta bu ste /
translated: The first is loving kindness, which is like a friend.

original: rang gi snying du bcug pa gcig la byams pa skye //
analyzed: rang gi snying du bcug pa gcig la byams pa skye //
translated: Loving kindness arises for one person who is very dear to one's heart.

original: de bzhin du gnyen rab 'bring gsum la sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyen rab 'bring gsum la sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, one extends it to one's friends, to those who are neutral, and to one's enemies.

original: yang tha mal pa rab 'bring gsum dang dgra rab 'bring gsum du sems can thams cad la bsgom mo //
analyzed: yang tha mal pa rab 'bring gsum dang dgra rab 'bring gsum du sems can thams cad la bsgom mo //
translated: Again, one should meditate on all sentient beings as being the three types of ordinary beings, high, medium, and low, and the three types of enemies, high, medium, and low.

original: yang de bzhin du sdug bsngal che 'bring dgu dang zag pa med pa bla na med pa'i bde ba rab @254a * //
analyzed: yang de bzhin du sdug bsngal che 'bring dgu dang zag pa med pa bla na med pa'i bde ba rab @254a * //
translated: Again, in the same way, one should meditate on the nine degrees of great, medium, and low suffering and the nine degrees of great, medium, and low of the uncontaminated, unsurpassed bliss.

original: 'bring dgu ru gong ma rnams la bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'bring dgu ru gong ma rnams la bsgom mo //
translated: One should meditate on the high ones.

original: btang snyoms ni dga' ba'i snod du bsgom pa'am yang na dmigs pa med par bsgom mo //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni dga' ba'i snod du bsgom pa'am yang na dmigs pa med par bsgom mo //
translated: Equanimity is meditated on as the vessel of joy, or else it is meditated on without a focus.

original: stong pa nyid sngags dang bcas pa ye shes kyi tshogs bsags la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid sngags dang bcas pa ye shes kyi tshogs bsags la /
translated: The accumulation of the collection of wisdom is done with the mantra of emptiness.

original: yang na stong pa'i byang chub ces pas gzung ngo //
analyzed: yang na stong pa'i byang chub ces pas gzung ngo //
translated: Or else, one should apprehend with “the emptiness of enlightenment.”

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rjes la rang gi mdun med de stong pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rjes la rang gi mdun med de stong pa zhig ce na /
translated: After the accumulation of the collection of wisdom, if one asks, “Is there nothing in front of oneself, that is, emptiness?”

original: rang gi blos chos stong par byas pas rang gi lus tha mal pa ltar snang ba de'i'o //🔽mdun du re pha nyi ma la //
analyzed: rang gi blos chos stong par byas pas rang gi lus tha mal pa ltar snang ba de'i'o // mdun du re pha nyi ma la //
translated: It is the emptiness of one’s own mind, which appears as one’s ordinary body.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis rten bsgrubs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis rten bsgrubs te /
translated: The support is accomplished with two verses, beginning with “In front, the sun with the letter hūṃ.”

original: ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor h'um las sna tshogs rdo rje la h'um gis mtshan pa /
analyzed: ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor h'um las sna tshogs rdo rje la h'um gis mtshan pa /
translated: From Ra, a sun mandala arises, and from Hum, a crossed vajra marked with Hum.

original: de las 'od zer 'phros pas phyogs su rang steng du gur bcing ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de las 'od zer 'phros pas phyogs su rang steng du gur bcing ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Light rays radiate from that, and the direction is bound above with a tent.

original: 'og kyang rdo rje'i sa gzhi'o //
analyzed: 'og kyang rdo rje'i sa gzhi'o //
translated: The vajra ground is below.

original: chos kyi 'byung gnas ni bsgoms na yang sgom /
analyzed: chos kyi 'byung gnas ni bsgoms na yang sgom /
translated: If one meditates on the source of phenomena, it is meditated.

original: ma bsgoms kyang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: ma bsgoms kyang 'gal ba med do //
translated: If one does not meditate, there is no contradiction.

original: de'i nang du ro bsgom mo //
analyzed: de'i nang du ro bsgom mo //
translated: Meditate on the corpse inside that.

original: da ni brten pa lha bsgom pa ni rdo rje rnam bzhis bskyed /
analyzed: da ni brten pa lha bsgom pa ni rdo rje rnam bzhis bskyed /
translated: Now, the meditation on the supported deity is generated by the four vajras.

original: yang ni ste ye shes kyi tshogs la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: yang ni ste ye shes kyi tshogs la ltos pa'o //
translated: Again, in dependence on the accumulation of wisdom,

original: stong pa ste chos nyid dang / byang chub ste ye shes so //
analyzed: stong pa ste chos nyid dang / byang chub ste ye shes so //
translated: the emptiness of reality and the wisdom of enlightenment

original: de nas gnyis pa la sa bon bsdu ba ni h'um las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nas gnyis pa la sa bon bsdu ba ni h'um las byung ba'o //
translated: are gathered into the seed syllable in the second stage, which arises from Hum.

original: gsum pa la gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa'o //
translated: In the third stage, the form is complete.

original: rdo rje ni kha dog nag po 'jigs chen no //
analyzed: rdo rje ni kha dog nag po 'jigs chen no //
translated: The vajra is black in color and very frightening.

original: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod pa ni /
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod pa ni /
translated: In the fourth stage, the syllables are arranged.

original: rdo rje'i lte ba'i dbus gnas par //
analyzed: rdo rje'i lte ba'i dbus gnas par //
translated: In the center of the vajra hub,

original: yang ni h'um gi de nyid bsgom //
analyzed: yang ni h'um gi de nyid bsgom //
translated: Again, one should meditate on the reality of the HŪṂ.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens from that?

original: h'um gi rnam par gyur pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis so //
analyzed: h'um gi rnam par gyur pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis so //
translated: The half-verse beginning with “The transformation into the form of HŪṂ” is the second half-verse.

original: sems dpa' sum brtsegs bsgom /
analyzed: sems dpa' sum brtsegs bsgom /
translated: One should meditate on the three nested sattvas.🔽One should invite the wisdom being that is similar to oneself.

original: rang 'dra ba'i ye shes pa dgug / skye mched byin gyis brlab pa mos tshul lam bskyed pa'i tshul gang rung ba'o //
analyzed: rang 'dra ba'i ye shes pa dgug / skye mched byin gyis brlab pa mos tshul lam bskyed pa'i tshul gang rung ba'o //
translated: The way of consecrating the sense bases is either the way of imagining or the way of generating.

original: dbang bskur ba nas mchod bstong bdud rtsi myang ba byas la /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba nas mchod bstong bdud rtsi myang ba byas la /
translated: Having performed the empowerment conferral, offering, praise, and tasting the elixir,

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa cung zad bsgom //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa cung zad bsgom //
translated: one should meditate a little on the completion stage.

original: sngags kyi bzlas pa bya /
analyzed: sngags kyi bzlas pa bya /
translated: One should perform the mantra recitation.

original: gtor ma btang /
analyzed: gtor ma btang /
translated: One should offer the bali.
